author: Greg Daly
title: Excellent build quality, noticable deadzone and terrible brake
content:
I was extremely excited to try the G920, as I've been playing a lot of Forza 6 since release. I received it one day after release, having preordered it. I'm actually going to be returning it after a week of trial and looking to a different brand, as I feel that are a couple of fundamental flaws that don't belong in a $400 product. These views are after several hours of use in Forza 6 and Forza Horizon 2 on Xbox One.

First, the brake 'feature.' The amount of force required to press the brake is so great that I was deflecting the heavy-gauge plate steel on my openwheeler racing seat setup about an inch, and not registering more than 55% press. Thus, I had to set the max to 55 in my game settings. This isn't a realistic feel at all, unless you're trying to duplicate the feel of cable-pull brakes from the early 20th century. I also don't like that I am losing a ton of resolution by having to set the range so low, and on top of that, you're only really guessing where the brake bottoms out. It's a huge issue, in my opinion.

Second, the center deadzone. I read and watched every review I could before purchasing this wheel, and they all said something to the effect of 'it has a deadzone, just like all helical gear wheels do.' Having never owned a racing wheel before, I figured that it was no big deal as it was written off so casually. That's completely false. This is the best way I can explain it - if you drive a modern car on a freeway, and you're on a freeway (60+mph) curve, you'll be turning your steering wheel and operating your car completely capably at about 1/3 of the deadzone this wheel has. This leads to very little feel on high-speed curves, and I constantly was fishtailing on straights after curves until I set a center deadzone in my game settings. A quality piece of equipment should not necessitate this, in my opinion.

A minor nag - the white LED is extremely bright, and in your face if you look at the wheel itself. Not an issue while you're playing, but any time you look at the buttons to navigate menus, or if you're in a darkened room, it's really annoying.

The good stuff:

The construction quality is top-notch. All of the materials are very nice and the setup has a superb fit and finish. It's a very nice looking setup, and it feels good to use. The paddle shifters have a satisfying click and travel.

Packaging and setup are great - just a few unsealed bags and twist ties to go through. The clamps to hold the wheel on seem to work very well.

There's a USB quick-release on the cord, so you can leave the plug in your xbox if you need to disconnect the wheel. This leaves a very short cable hanging out, which is very convenient.

I wish I could recommend this product, but I can't. The flaws are just too much to overcome for me.

author: James Trub
title: Top Notch Racing Wheel
content: Hey guys, just wanted to put out a few words reviewing the new Logitech G29 racing wheel. I am not sure what the rest of 1 star reviewers are talking about, but that wheel is absolutely awesome. Yes, it is pricey and yes it is more money than the old G27 and yes it does not come with gear shifter anymore which you would have to buy separate for another 60 bux. BUT let me tell you something, that wheel is as sweet as it gets. Brake pedal feedback is huge improvement. All buttons now are on the actual wheel so who needs a shifter anyway when you have the paddle shifters. Use the gear shifter mount to hold your beer can or something. As usual Logitech did not disappoint me as far as quality and looks. Leather stitching, wheel all anodized aluminum or stainless steel components. Beautiful design over all. Noise is undetected; wheel turns smooth and very quiet... Wheel response and feedback are on point and pretty realistic. I am sorry for the negative fellow racing sim gamers, but I can confidently give the new G29 a 5 star review.  Go ahead and check out some of the pics I took of it so you have a better idea how it fits on my Openwheeler Racing Wheel Stand Cockpit Blue/Black | For Logitech G29 | G920 and Logitech G27 | G25 | Thrustmaster Wheels | Racing wheel & controllers NOT included rig.

It is very well built, even though a lot of the material used is plastic, the overall feel of the product is solid.

author: Jorge T.
title: Crappy kids toy with tons of issues.
content:
Meh, i dont see what all the fuss is about with this controller. I bought this because its listed on many websites and vlogs claiming this wheel is the best entry level sim racer controller, great quality, sim racing, sim-rig, blah blah, etc.

I guess what they dont disclose is that they are attention-whoring corporate shills desperately trying to be “influencers”. I will tell you honestly that this controller is just a cheap feeling toy.
I went and spent over 1k on a racing rig that feels crappy at the very least. Money down the drain, thanks to target advertising and brain washing by nerds who have never even sat in a high performance car.
A decent racing simulator will end up costing as much as a track car. Id rather do the real thing. The desert is real.

The build quality and design:
Its basically a micro steering wheel thats smaller than a riding lawnmower steering wheel. The wheel and shifter claim to be real genuine leather... which is probably made from scraps because it feels worse than vinyl. The “leather” on the shifter boot is all crunchy and dry.
I actually installed an aftermarket shifter knob because the little butt plug knob logitech installed looked pathetic.
The mechanical design feels very cheap. I can feel the plastic gears grinding inside. Also the violent forcefeedback feels way off.

Oh, lets not forget about the mandatory software. So Logitech crams down their spyware called Logitech Game Controller which data logs everything on your PC. This instrusive bloatware rapes 3-400mb of ram and keylogs your keystrokes.
To be fair, the Logitech spyware is less invasive than Corsair iCUE and Razer Synapse apps. Those require email and direct app connections to their server client and Razer even hijacks customer PC’s to mine bitcoins.(not making this up)
BTW this app is necessary in order to use the wheel controller because the wheel will have tons of software issues.

I spent so much time trouble shooting that i spent less time playing games with it. I kept getting a flashing xbox button. After hrs wasted on finding a fix, the pedals crapped out on me.
The gas pedal mysteriously stopped working. After many hours of reserching on the internet, i found that many people have the same issues as i have and never found a solution to fix them.
In the end, i had more fun shopping for PC crap and building than actually playing anything on this junk.

I understand that these controllers are just for fun, and that they should be marketed as toys... but they are not.
I am just salty because every ignorant douche swears by this logitech set up as some awesome controller.

author: Brad

author: Clari Dee
title: Look no where else, THIS IS THE WHEEL YOU WANT!!!
content:
First of all, I bought this wheel yesterday, I didn't buy it from amazon, but let me tell you that the place where I bought had this in retail for $400!!!! They DID price match amazon's low price. I usually always shop at amazon. So, any product I buy and is sold here. I write a review for it. :)

I have played sim racers since Gran Turismo 1. I have used more than one wheel in the past with force feed back and without. This is by far the best I have used. I use this wheel with forza 6 and Dirt Rally. The wheel feels very very very responsive after adjusting the settings for one game at a time. You feel all the bumps, all the road textures, road and or surface tilt. You name it. Don't be skeptical, this is probably the value for your money. It's not cheap, I love the hand stitched leather wheel, the pedals are sturdy. Forget about those bad reviews about the brake pedal being too hard. I doubt those guys ever driven a var in real life. This is as good as it gets. You will love the for feedback!!!! It took me about 6 hour to dominate the lower class cars in forza. I beat all the stars in the reasonably priced car Vauxhall Astra top gear edition. My time was 1:44.5. Yeah!!! You will not regret your purchase, definitely get the shifter if you're as passionate about racing Sims like me. It's a great addition. Support your product with a service plan too!!!

Follow up review Dec 15, 2015
After I updated the FW on my XBOX ONE, the wheel stopped working, and cannot be detected at all.  Oddly, on my PC Win10 the wheel is still recognized with my "Project Cars" game only.  F1 2015 can see the wheel but it will not function correctly. I have started my return for refund process but I cancelled the request in hopes that Logitech will have a firmware / driver patch later. (HOPEFULLY)  I like the wheel and it is working with my PC so I decided to hang on to this G920.

author: David T
title: Great wheel if you get one that doesn't have the squeak
content: The wheel began making a horrible high pitched squeaking noise when turning left after only 2 weeks of use. After doing some research I'm finding this is a very common issue, so common in fact that replacements often suffer the same issue. The G29's performance doesn't seem to be affected, as a wheel it's great for the price point but the squeak forces me to wear headphones or have the TV turned up. I held off on buying the G29 simply because its no different from the G27 aside from the button layout (and the needless incompatibility of the G27 & the PS4). I think it's a good wheel if you get a good one, but be prepared to deal with a squeak or the return process.

author: Andrew Hill
title: Above And Beyond My Expectations
content:
I've only had my G29 w/ Clutch for about 3 days but I mainly bought it for ETS2 and ATS2. Both games I've loved playing with keyboard and mouse but ever since I received this product i've been extremely happy.

Let's start from the start....

I first looked into steering wheels over 2 weeks back. My friend had a G27 and watched 3 different videos on that product. I soon realized that with the amount of buttons and configurations that it had it would fit me for my needs in my games fine. I soon realized that the G27 is no longer available for purchase at least not brand new. I then saw the G29 VS G920 video. I soon began to realize that both of these wheels were the next gen for consoles with PC support. I looked at the G920 first and realized it didn't have as many button configurations that would allow me to play my trucking games the way I wanted. I then looked at the G29.

Now my system is a gaming laptop. I have only 3 USB slots ( which currently take up my mouse, keyboard, and USB adapter headset.) so I soon realized that I would have to drop my keyboard in order to use this. Now, I wanted to make sure that the G29 was compatible with a laptop and it's limited amount of power as well as usb slots. I ran across a video a week ago where a guy was installing the G29 into a laptop (randomly) and it worked. I purchased afterwords and received my product.

Weird thing with one of my games, which I believe is a game flaw, not a G29 flaw, is that I have to start up the game, unplug and replug my G29 back in to get auto centering and feedback into my wheel. Otherwise she's a loose goose that just turns wherever and doesn't auto center back. This is the smallest issue I could ever think of to have with this item so I am extremely happy.

Again, 72 hours later, I am still playing with it with only 4 hours of sleep. I'd better get back because those loads aren't going to travel themselves...

author: BigTastie
title: Instructions to mod.. and kind of a review
content: There is a modification very much needed to play the wheel comfortably and not having to jam your foot on the brake pedal. There's a small rubber stopper inside the spring of the brake pedal that makes it impossible to press it all of the way down, therefore pressing it half way makes you brake 100%. The easy way to do this mod it to remove all the pedal "covers first, meaning the 2 screws on the front of all the pedals. Then unscrew all the silver acres on the back of the assembly. Finally unscrew the long hex screw with a hex screwdriver and plyers. Take the rubber piece out of the spring. And reverse all the steps listed. Type joy.cpl I think to calibrate everything so it's 100% accurate.

author: Topher LD
title: Awesome Controller!!!
content:
So I just received this. I haven’t gotten the game I plan to use it with yet, but I can tell you, the G920 is SOLID. I unboxed it and hooked it up, and could immediately tell that it was well worth the money. The motors inside the wheel do an amazing job! It feels like a real car. And the leather smell is a great perk 😉.
I’ve seen a lot of reviews here & on YouTube about the brake pedal resistance. I will say that yes, it is very high. However, over the past few hours I have been just pushing on it while watching tv & found that it is less resistant then it was out of the box, so my recommendation is to “break it in” (pun). It will get less resistant if you spend the time to just push as hard as you can on it for a while.
I’ll try to update when I receive the F1 game & actually use it with that, but it’s great so much as I can tell. Just wish it had the LED’s for shifting that the G29/PS4 has. Also, I wish the clamps for the steering wheel were a little better designed. Only complaint to give it 4 stars.

author: Nick
title: Worth the deal
content: I've been looking for a Wheel for racing games and I found one that was worth it! Thanks Logitech

author: Amazon Customer
title: Awesome
content: Great

author: IMPEACH 45 !
title: Awesome !!
content: Worth every penny.

author: Mike Bennett
title: Best wheel and peddle package for the price
content: Amazing wheel, I've had the G27 and the G29 and have used a Fanatec wheel in the past and I still prefer this wheel. For the price you can't beat the package with the wheel and the peddles. Fast shipping and was still sealed brand new. I been on PC racing sims for over 8 years and I would say this is a great wheel for all levels of sim racers.

author: Mike C
title: Excellent first racing wheel
content:
Pulled the trigger on the G29 after looking for some better VR experiences.  Project Cars 2, which I already owned from a Steam Summer sale went form a "meh, this is fun but I'm not into sim racing" to "Holy $h17, VR puts me in the car!" to "I need a wheel because VR racing with an Xbox 360 controller just doesn't cut it".  Debated between this and the T150 and ended with the G29 mainly from a few reviews and the additional buttons on the wheel... also it was on sale that day.

My thoughts about the G29 itself...  Great size feel/grip from the wheel.  It feels substantial and weighty.  The force feedback is strong enough to give me the perception that I'm driving the real thing.  The weight of the pedals feel right and the sensitivity make me feel like I can be very precises with my throttle and breaking.  The button layout works and once you learn it, is easy to blindly manipulate in VR.  All in all, I'm very happy and would recommend this to anyone debating a 1st time wheel purchase.

author: Edgar Landaverde
title: todo bien
content: todo bien

author: Blake Coyle
title: Five Stars
content: Nice wheel for the money

author: Vincent R. Logiudice
title: Meh
content: After using the Thrustmaster TMX Pro Ferrari Italia edition, I could not use this. It was too toy like and just to top it off... It squeaks when you turn it... It drove me nuts (2nd day of use) so I just returned it. The pedals are super close together and the brake required super effort to use. It is a good steering wheel but I'm very picky.

author: Jacob
title: Love everything except the brake pedal.
content: Still super fun to play with. Brake pedal is obnoxious.

author: Brandon
title: Looks pretty.....
content: But that's about what it's worth now. The unit seems to lose its place with the wheel position sensor (which is now digital as opposed the the mechanical sensor that was on the g25 and g27. Especially when drifting, I m ight get one lap before I have to hold the wheel 90° to the left in order to get the car to go straight. Reset the wheel and it fixes itself for a lap or less. Got the wheel replaces under warranty and new wheel did the same thing. I was hoping the position sensor was the same design as the g27 and I could fix the issue but all I did was void my warranty and waste my time digging into it. Oh well

author: Bob
title: The box arrived with a large dent in the corner ...
content:
The box arrived with a large dent in the corner.  It seems to work though, other than the down button always registering twice whenever it is hit.
Seems well built.  It has a bit of play in the neutral position but very little rotation is needed to make a turn.  That makes is bit hard to control.

author: Trevor J. Lopez
title: Makes squeak when turning left.
content:
When i got this wheel, i figured spending 300 bucks on it would mean it is a quality product. As soon as i get it, it squeals a high pitched noise when turning left only. Turning right yields no noise. Really??

Searching online finds a bunch of other people with the same issue, all turning left. Can you guys not make a quality product or some thing?

Dont buy this, save your money or buy the thrustmaster tmx pro. I wish i would have.

author: Brian & Zaida Newton
title: Perfectly acceptable for iRacing without breaking the bank.
content: Being new to serious sim racing I wanted good enough equipment, but I also didn't want to spend too much on equipment that is FAR more capable than I am.  Turns out the G29 was an excellent choice.  I've done every kind of racing, for up to 4 solid hours for a year and a half and nothing seems worn.  I am now using a refurbished wheel because there was an electronic fault in the new one(why it's not 5 stars), but I was sent the replacement quickly and without hassle.  I would definitely recommend as a great low-mid range wheel that will be more than adequate for 99% of people.

author: Animal ER nurse
title: Worth the money
content: Works fantastic.  Need to be a little tech savvy.  Great quality.

author: Alex
title: Absolutely nuts
content: I got this racing wheel as a gift and it is absolutely bananas, for one, when you plug it into your PC (which is how I'm using it) the whole wheel turns lock to lock, the force feedback is nuts and I literally can't stop smiling when I use it, it's absolutely bonkers. I was fortunate enough to get the shift knob as well, and that thing is really cool too. It took me a while to figure it out but eventually I figured out that in order to put a car into reverse you have to press the shifter in and then put it into gear. The amount of resistance is kind of a workout, I don't know if I was sweating from the resistance or if I was sweating because I was so excited, either way, so cool.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: I am glad that the product arrived safely.

author: Amanda Case
title: Great for the older Forza race games, not the newest one
content: I bought this for my husband for Christmas to play with the latest Forza game and he quickly discovered that it doesn't work great with that one.  But what started out as disappointment turned into excitement when he realized that it is great for a couple of his older Forza games that are more of the track racing style!  He had given up on those games because they were too difficult to play with the controller, but with this he can now enjoy them again.

author: asdfate
title: The Squeakmaker
content: This thing squeaks when you turn the wheel. Sometimes it's really bad, sometimes it's barely noticeable, but it's always squeaking.  Other than that, it's solid and it works and there's plenty of buttons to configure. I did have to get in touch with tech support as some of the buttons weren't working originally, but they helped and it is now working.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Can't recommend this product for use on laptop or PC
content: Never got it to work.  Every time I plugged USB into my laptop, it crashed my computer.  Support told me I needed to send them a "dump file".  I'm no software engineer.  To get the dump file, I would have had to plug in the USB again, crashing my computer yet again.  Couldn't upload the dump file even after I thought I had it.  Can't recommend this product for use on laptop or PC. Returned it.

author: Carliss Cook
title: Old men like to have fun too...
content: FUN! FUN! FUN!

author: JT
title: Fun. Fun. Fun.
content: Fun. Fun. Fun. Great realism given a desk mounting simulator.

author: Dede
title: Great!
content: Easy to setup and great product.

author: Evan J. Heavey
title: Amazing!
content: Absolutely love this gaming wheel! The force feedback is plenty strong if you ask me. Only the sturdiest of gaming rigs will hold this thing steady. The pedals feel great, the fit and finish on the wheel is great. It's held up to countless sweaty palm racing weekends with friends. The white power LED that others have complained about I haven't even noticed. Only thing that nags me once in awhile are the buttons. I sometimes feel the need to just use my regular controller when making multiple tuning changes or dealing with the DVR. Now if only I could find a gaming rig that isn't double what I paid for the wheel and pedals!

author: JWFisher
title: Drive it like you stole it.
content:
It took a long time for me to jump in, being as expensive as the console I just couldn't stomach it.
Finally I did and man i don't regret it.  It brings a level of realism you just can't get twitching thumbs on a controller, and for my part most my game times have improved.

Pros:
solid construction, this thing is built well
Strong feedback, you can dial it in but out of the box its strong, it isn't likely to break grown fingers, but it will let you know the road is a moving.
built in paddles for high end exotics, or for manual shifting without the extra shifter.

Cons:
pedals are a bit close together, works best without shoes
Missing a few controller buttons so you can't do EVERYTHING you might want with just the wheel

author: J. Vrba
title: Good value.
content: Pretty good setup for the money.

author: Shanice
title: ... now i don't have the gear stick but i'm pretty sure i can still use the wheel and pedals ...
content: i started playing midnight club and notice i don't have any brakes i cant reverse either now i don't have the gear stick but i'm pretty sure i can still use the wheel and pedals for everything then all of a sudden my wheel has a mind of its own it keeps twitching to the left sigh.... please help

author: Jake
title: An AWESOME wheel with an OK Brake Pedal
content:
I've been using the G920 for a little over a week now. Almost 2 weeks. At first I was God awful with it. There is a small learning curve. But after a week I pretty well have it mastered.
It's of very nice quality. I like the leather rim, the metal wheel, the aluminum paddle shifters. It really feels like this thing was built to last.
I like the feel of the clutch and gas pedal, however the brake pedal takes ALOT of getting used to.
I purchased the ad on shifter as well, which also seems like a nice piece with the leather boot and sleeve. However after a week of use, 4th gear doesn't wanna pop in very easily. But I won't drop stars in this review since it's not included.
Now as an FYI I've only used this wheel so far with Forza Motorsport 6 and Forza Horizon 3 and it does work great for both, but I can't speak for other games. I plan to try Project Cars 2 and Asseto Corsa here soon. So I've heard, the wheel support for those games is far superior to Forza so there is no reason it shouldn't work.

If you're looking for an entry level wheel for the Xbox One, this so far has been a great buy and I highly recommend it. Especially over something like ThrustMasters Ferrari wheel.

author: William Cowin
title: step down from the G27
content: Having used a G27 set for over 2 years when it was time replace I went with the upgrade version. Sadly this is a downgrade to me. The wheel is not smooth, you can feel the gears jump and grind and the wheel is BRAND NEW. Profiler system for this wheel is not as good/easy as G27. The gas pedal is soft and the brake pedal is HARD and requires too much force. This is in the pedal set itself. I'm going to rebuild my G27 with new BRASS encoder and new Bodner cables then placed the G920 on ebay. If I ever have to buy another new set it will NOT be from Logitech......

author: JM
title: Five Stars
content: Great response time is easy to install.

author: JR
title: Love it
content: Son loves this as it gives him the actual feeling of driving with resistance and all in the steering wheel.

author: Kevin
title: Not good for backwards compatibility on PC
content:
First of all, I can't reflect on how well this device works on the PS3 or PS4. I bought this specifically for PC gaming.

I had a lot of racing games sitting in my Steam library, and I said to myself, "one of these days, I'll buy a wheel and play them". I finally bit the bullet and did it.

Unfortunately (as I found out after my purchase), there have been a lot of changes to the software in the G29 model. It's rendered the wheel incompatible with many of the racing games prior to 2015. It didn't serve the purpose that I bought it for, so I've returned it.

I gave it 3/5 because, physically, it seems like a solid wheel. The grip was good and it felt comfortable. I had no problems with assembly or attaching it securely to my desk. My only minor gripe is that there wasn't much distance between the brake and clutch. When you look at other similar racing pedals, it looks about typical, so that may have just been a comfort thing.

author: tony
title: Good but a little off
content: I liked the overall look and feel of the wheel but hated the tug and pull of the “dual motor” tried the setting still no go

author: Stephen Stepanek
title: Best competitive entry level wheel and pedal set
content: This is a great wheel for simracing! The pedals are OK, but I wasn't fond of the rubber stopper on the brake pedal. It wasn't bad, but just felt a little different. I upgraded my pedals for load cells, but the wheel is great and I have no reason at this time to swap it out.

author: berk
title: Four Stars
content: Been working fine now for some time. No issues.

author: Elena M. Flores
title: You won't be disappointed!
content:
EXCELLENT for Forza Motorsport.
Be patient and take the time to go through the settings. Once you have your preferences, this wheel will pay dividends.
Fantastic feel. Extremely durable. This was built to last.

author: Renee M Kooken
title: Fun
content: Hooked up easy but I recommend wearing shoes.

author: Octavio Z.
title: Perfect enter level sim racing setup
content: Product arrived on time and works great as intended. Feels sturdy, strong feedback motors. Perfect entry sim racing setup. I would buy again!

author: Joseph M McHale
title: This wheel is awesome..
content: This wheel is awesome... but I've had trouble with Logitech customer support on headset products, and am trying to stay away from them when I can.

author: Zachary pittman
title: Gooy buy
content: Works good for my video games

author: Lindsey
title: Fanatec but without the price tag
content:
If you’re looking for something similar to Fanatec but with out the price tag, this is perfect.
Got it as a gift for my husband and he LOVES it!!! He plays Gran Turismo (PS4) and he likes the force feedback and that it has the clutch pedal as well. Planning to get the shift knob attachment in the future.

author: Doffod
title: Makes racing game so much more fun!
content: I have been using it to play Forza on my Xbox for several weeks, it's such a great addition to the driving game, the steering, accelerating, and braking all seemed so realistic, making the game so much more fun to play than otherwise, completely satisfied!

author: Amazon Customer
title: awesome and super fun!
content:
after playing 100s hours of Project cars, Project cars 2, Assetto Corsa, F1 2017, dirt rally, and some beamNG.drive. i have compiled a few pros and cons for this wheel.
pro:
-great leather feel
-metal frame work
-awesome range
-force  feed back is quite strong
-was plug and play on ps4
-clips that are on the clamps are removable (however are hard to remove)
-lots of programable buttons
-has a clutch
-break pedal has resistance to it
-supported on lots of games
-pedals are metal
-adjustable clamps that mount to table and hold tight

cons
-the force feedback sometime feels like it doesn't translate the resistance very well. in some cases the wheel is choppy, rather than a consistent resistance
-The wheel can be loud and makes a grinding sound that sounds like it breaking.
-the base and clamps are made of plastic and feel cheap
-although the clamps are great at holding on to the table, the pegs you turn to tighten the clamps are plastic and are slippery. this make it difficult to remove if you over tighten. on top of that when the pegs can be brought down in to the base but sometime get stuck.
-if you are playing on pc you need to install a program before you can use it.
-lastly the wheel size is kinda small, and feel a bit awkward

author: Thipvipa
title: THE BEST WHEEL I HAVE EVER TRIED EVER !!!
content: I loved it. This has to be the best wheel I have ever used and the force feedback is great and also the steering is nice but there is one thing that bugs  me which is that the pedals the break is quite hard or really hard and it makes the whole pedal set slide with is a problem but other things it is great and it also works great on forza horizon 3 and forza motorsport 7 which is the games that I play right now. And also this wheel when I checked has a lower force feed back thing but when I used it it was great everything felt right. And speaking of what felt right I would say the wheel size is also nice. It is not too big to handle and not too small for a child. And also this wheel has one of the best looks I have ever seen on a steering wheel. There is also another version which is the g29 which is the same thing but for the ps4. I think that wheel looks likes a kids toy because of the bluish design but on this wheel everything looks right especially the quality on the wheel and the pedals. With mainly mental the wheel is great and just feels like it would live really long. And also I think that this wheel specifically is a good price for this great wheel because of you seen something like this and if it is from fanatec it would be a lot more expensive.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Immersive Experiences Await You!
content: If you're to take your racing game experience to the next level, look no further.  The Logitech G920 Racing Wheel is an amazing thing, and will increase your favorite racing sim fun-factor 10-fold!  With its leather-wrapped rim, anodized aluminum face, and brushed aluminum paddle shifters, this wheel is certainly a gorgeous thing to behold; much better looking than any of its competitors or its sister wheel, the G29.  The pedals themselves are very heavy duty, made of I believe brushed aluminum (pedal faces) and stainless steel, and have taken all the punishment I've doled out since its first use with ease.  This is truly a quality product.  I use this with an Xbox One, and so far have been playing the s*** out of Forza Horizon 2.  The force feedback has been great; not at all weak as some vocal minority have said.  You feel every bump, you feel under/oversteer, you feel damn near every little thing that your virtual car goes through.  It's simply amazing, especially with a good quality headset.  I built a custom gaming rig (which I HIGHLY recommend) that I use with this.  I have the pedal inverted which makes for better pedal feel.  All in all, this setup is wonderful and I highly recommend it for any racing sim enthusiast out there!

author: Jodi
title: Five Stars
content: Came fast! My son loves it for Christmas!

author: Practical Driver
title: good for gamers, not for real racers
content:
If all you know is gaming, I'm sure this wheel will blow your mind.

I do HPDE track days and I currently drive a Lancer EVO X. The steering feel of this wheel is an insult to my EVO in real life. It feels so fake and inaccurate I want to return the wheel. LOL. Particularly the wheel is not fast enough to emulate the real feeling of the grip of the tires as you drive at the limit. In real life If I exceed the tires grip I can make lightnig fast corrections to reblance weight to regain grip. On this wheel once I exceed the limit there is this dead zone where the wheel / programming doesn't know what to do and I'm spinning out like a noob regardless of the corrections I make. Amateur hour at it's finest! Learn to drive on this and come out to the track and you'll get your ass handed to you. LOL.

author: Francisco Ingles
title: It's better tov use than the G27 I had before
content:
It's better tov use than the G27 I had before, but it broke the fixing the first week, and after that I had to retighten all housing and internal screws, that were loosening...
The Momo and G25 were best manufacturing quality pieces; the G27 was a better technology, but not as reliable; now I am afraid the G29 will not last long.
I buy Logitech wheels since 2007, so I can feel the difference.

author: Kris
title: Poor Customer Support. Worst logitech item I ever bought.
content: I purchased this steering wheel about a year ago and in less than 2 weeks of owning it, the ps3-ps4 compatibility switch already broke. Paddle shifts do not work at a certain angle. I tried to contact customer support but they can't help me because I only have a FPO address. Needless to say, I'm stuck with this garbage..

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great product
content: Good product, hard to store it away when you arent using it.

author: Jessie Lance Ashby
title: love it
content: Love so far played many trucking and simulated games havent tried on xbox1 yet will soon

author: Mindy Zacker
title: First wheel and it's been great.
content:
I got this to play F12019 on PS4 and possibly iRacing on the computer later if I can improve enough. The leather wrapped wheel and metal finish is excellent quality. I think I'm going to have to adjust the force feedback as it is very hard to control as a beginner. It will have so much force at times it sends you right off track. The pedals work amazing and offer you so much more throttle/brake control compared to a controller.

If you want a first time steering wheel but don't want to dish out over a $1,000 for a Fanatec then I highly recommend this. Excellent quality and a perfect starter wheel and pedals.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Best wheel for xbox one and PC
content: This wheel is hands down amazing. The quality is great!

author: Shane H.
title: Huge dead zone
content:
Really disappointed with this wheel. It doesn't feel anything close to a real car. The wheel is tiny and there is more play at the top than a 60's muscle car
You find yourself constantly swerving to counter the centering spring. No matter what settings I tried it was awful. Even turning the force feedback and centering spring off only helps a little, but then what's the point of spending the extra money? It's better on ps4 than pc. I though it was defective but when I looked around I found almost everyone has the same problem with it. Don't waste your money I returned mine.

author: Tate
title: Gilded garbage
content: I don’t have enough time to go over all the Problems have with this product and I’ve only had it a mere few days. The wheel’s exterior material flaunts fancy leather but is, in words: gilded, a dipped gold, not gold, just pretending. The plastic is like that of a Walmart shopping cart. It took far too long to set up and has already broken 5 times and I’ve had to spend hours fixing it. Now the pedals (namely the clutch) have just stopped responding all together. I’ve read everything on this page amongst other forums and videos to solve these problems an nothing has worked.

author: Antonio smith
title: is that this IS the best wheel you can buy for the money and and ...
content: I am a Logitech freak so all I have to say is, is that this IS the best wheel you can buy for the money and and like them so much that I have 2 of them!

author: A. Williams
title: Love my Wheel & Pedals
content:
This is my fifth wheel and pedal setup (Not including the silly wii wheel.) I love the G29. As I've said, I've owned several other setups. (Still do, if anyone is looking for an older setup.) This the best I've ever had. Maybe someday I'll be able to afford one of those $400 or $500 sim wheels. I've been playing racing sims since the original Papyrus Indy Car game came out.

All of the devices I've had before are somewhat "clunky." The wheel was not smooth and it was difficult to be precise when running three or four wide. You'd often end up tagging the wall or sliding across the grass due to the motion of the wheel. The force feedback wasn't very precise either. Sometimes you'd get a real jerk on the wheel. Other times, you wouldn't feel anything at all.

This is all corrected with the G29. While you can still feel the individual gear cogs meshing with each other, the feeling is unnoticable while you're racing. The movement of the wheel is much more smooth and the force feedback is very consistent.

I highly recommend the Logitech Dual-Motor Feedback Driving Force G29 Racing Wheel with Responsive Pedals for Playstation 4 and Playstation 3 to any racing sim enthusiast. I also recommending getting the matching shifter for it.

The only con to this setup is that the pedals are a little too close together. I have a Size 12 foot with a narrow instep, and average foot width. It is difficult not to hit the clutch and brake at the same time. When using the right foot to brake, it's hard to completely clear the accelerator when going for the brake. I've purchased some racing style shoes and this makes it feel a little better. The pedals are smooth and made of metal. I love that the metal is quality and makes the pedals feel very durable and more realistic. However, you have to wear shoes of some type or it is easy to have your foot slide off of the pedals.

I still highly recommend the Logitech Dual-Motor Feedback Driving Force G29 Racing Wheel with Responsive Pedals. purchase and go racing.

author: jammpls
title: This makes driving games so much better. Works great with Project Cars and Forza titles
content: This makes driving games so much better.  Works great with Project Cars and Forza titles.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I have to have the spring either super tight or completely loose
content: It is a bit difficult to get it set up for Euro Trucker 2 and American Truck.  I have to have the spring either super tight or completely loose.

author: Jay L
title: I think you have to make a tough decision on how much you love sim racing
content:
A premium product for an extra premium price tag... At this price, I think you have to make a tough decision on how much you love sim racing.

I have good personal experience with Logitech wheels, having owned both the G27 and the GT Driving Force. The GT Driving Force put against this is made the GT a definite toy. But G29 is a class on its own no matter what you compare against. And to get this out of the way: I definitely do not miss the manual shifter, since it was never really all that useful in the G27, even less so with these modern games and modern cars. However, for it to be optional but no apparent reduction in price is unfortunate. Furthermore, the 3rd pedal still comes along anyway, which is kind of a waste of space, added cost, and just plain in the way.

But boy these pedals are shiny! The construction is superb. I think Logitech pulled all the stop. The blue on the wheel is a very nice touch. It's got a very premium feel, and I'm glad to they have improved on all aspects of the G27, instead of trying to cut corners and cost (except the H gate :) ).

What I love the most is how quiet the wheel is. When it autoturns for calibration, it's as if nothing is happening. This is a big plus in my book. Love it.

My gripes are limited to how this product is crippled on the PS3: the rev counter does not work (tested in GT6). This is so unfortunate. The flash on startup, but not usable in the game. Also, the "Select" and "Start" buttons are replaced by "Share" and "Options" button on the wheel. It is what it is I guess.

I have gotten used to the D-pad being above the wheel, instead of the GT where level with the horn (this G29 has no horn in middle). I wish they were further down each time I use them, but I can live with them sitting above. It's nice to have the L and R buttons in front of me (though the little blue buttons look bit goofy), instead of behind the wheel in the GT wheel.

In a nutshell, if you can afford this, congratulations, you just found the perfect wheel for your PlayStation. If you can't right now, wait for a used one because the quality of this thing means it will last ages.

author: 50pascals
title: Has issues after only 2 hours.
content:
Within 2 hours of use it makes a high pitched squealing noise on left turns. Browsing forums I see that this is a known issue. I have contacted the support line and will change my review accordingly.
Update.
I received a replacement from Amazon all was good. Its day 2 on the replacement and it is now making the same noise as the first.

author: CR
title: Logitech Dual-motor Feedback Driving Force G29 for PS4
content: Great wheel expensive, just wished logitech made software upgrade for the old  PS3 wheels, but then suppose would be harder to sell the new PS4 wheel....!!

author: Nate Finch
title: The force feedback is very strong and the build quality is great.
content: This thing is a beast.  The force feedback is very strong and the build quality is great.

author: Javier Rivas
title: Increíble
content: Increíble, tal y como lo describen, mejor control, mucho más realista, tensión y fuerza en el guía!!!

author: Frank J.
title: Offers a real experience and fun for all
content: Grandson love it.

author: blake tregre
title: I LOVE IT!!!!
content: Got to my house in 4 days and great quality for the price!!!!

author: ABRAHAM B.
title: EXCELLENT QUALITY
content: Excellent quality product. It's compatible with a lot og games but in others supposed to be very complicated to set up. It depends the game /software more than this device. Very happy with this.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: Good :)

author: Dave
title: Great Gaming Wheel
content: Great product, just have to edit the settings for every game which is a pain. Other than that, once you get the perfect setting the wheel feels awesome and is incredibly addicting to play with.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: This thing is awesome.

author: Claudio
title: I love the way the g29 feels in all aspects
content: Moving from the g27 to the g29, I thought it wouldn't be much of a difference. I love the way the g29 feels in all aspects. Several games I have used it on had absolutely no issues what so ever. I even made it work on games it doesn't naturally work on. I was able to use my g27 shifter on it still. Even though the buttons don't work on it, it still works amazingly! Highly recommended.

author: Lance
title: Buyer Beware - Brake pedel Disappointment.
content: Horrible, The wheel shakes violently on most of my games. (Probably Defective), The brake pedel "Stopping mechanism" is a horrible design. Never buy this product. Ever.

author: Curt
title: Better than belt driven
content: Love this wheel. Did A LOT of research and this wheel does the job everytime. Very durable and would rather have this than another with a belt driven system. Force feedback feels pretty real. Yes its older and they say the belt is smoother. Well real race cars aren't smooth. They arent driven by belts that eventually fail. Buy this and don't be disappointed.

author: Cheri Butson
title: Five Stars
content: Love it!

author: David Nicholson
title: Egregious design flaw
content: The wheel and pedals are supposed to be designed to work with Forza. They don't. The brake pedal can only achieve 50% braking if you stand on it with so much force it feels like you are going to break something. Normal heavy braking force gets you do about 8 percent. It is idiotic and undriveable. There is no way to adjust sensitivity enough to allow for full brake travel. It's a design flaw. There is a rubber bushing inside the spring in the pedal mechanism that is designed to give feedback. It is too large for Forza. You have two choices. Return the set for something else, or remove the rubber completely/cut it to between 50 an 75 percent of it's original length. The person at Logitech responsible for testing this should be fired. There are Youtube videos that show you how to do the mod.

author: balto113
title: Great product. Brake pedal feels a little fake
content: Great product. Brake pedal feels a little fake. It's hard and will push u back if you're not sturdy on the floor. Steering wheel feels like a broken steering rack when running over grasses. But overall it's good.

author: Aaron Flamisch
title: Great beginner wheel!
content: For as long as I could remember I had wanted to be a professional Rally Racer.  Unfortunately, that requires a lot of money, so I settled for Rally simulation.  I did a fair amount of research and while I am aware that there may be objectively better wheels at this price point, the consensus seemed to be that this was the best wheel for an entry-level sim racer, and I couldn't agree more, I don't regret purchasing this wheel at all, and would recommend it to anyone.

author: Amazon Customer

author: Spartacus
title: Great deal on a great wheel.
content:
I got a great deal on this wheel on amazon; they were running a special and I was able to buy it brand-new for $286.99. The price has since gone back to $399.99... I have it mounted on a Playseat evolution.

Pros: It works with PS3, PS4 and PC. I've only tested this on PS4 playing DriveClub and Project Cars. In both games, the wheel is fantastic out of the box and can be modified to the user's preferences, more so in Project Cars than in DriveClub but never the less...

The force feedback is pretty good. This is my first wheel of the kind so I have no prior experience to compare it to but I think most gamers would appreciate it.

The pedals are better than anything out there at this price range. Compared to the T300 which comes with plastic pedals and no clutch, the Logitech pedals are very sturdy and work well.

The buttons on the wheel are excellent for PS4 and let you navigate around without needing the standard controller. The wheel can't power on the PS4 though, I've noticed. So I usually use the dualshock to turn it on and then login with the wheel.

Mounting to a playseat: the wheel itself is pretty easy to mount. The screw holes lined up perfectly with the platform on the chair however the pedals where a bit more challenging. I managed to mount the pedals with 2 screws but it took some effort to get it going. The screw holes will not easily line up with the pedals and you will have to spend some time looking for them.. but in the end, it does mount.

Looks: the wheel is leather wrapped and feels solid. the buttons are good enough. The pedals are metal and they look and feel like they can take a beating. The paddle shifters are of good quality; better quality than my car in real life that has plastic paddle shifters.

Cons: The obvious one is the not including a shifter and selling it for $400. Like I said earlier, i bought mine for $286.99 so I'm satisfied but for $400, they really should include the shifter.

The wheel itself is a little small. Once you start playing, you will forget that and won't care much but they really should make it a little bit bigger

Overall, I'm pretty happy with the purchase. I was between this and the Thrustmaster T300. In the end, the discounted price on amazon is what sealed the deal for me on this wheel. I figured it was worth a try and if I didn't like it, I would return it. I really enjoy it so far.

I have about 10 hours of playing time on it and haven't encountered any issues. A lot of people claim the G29 build is a refresh of the G27 model for PS3 and PC that has a pretty good reliability record.

I'm taking one star for the size of the wheel and not including a shifter. Otherwise, this is a great wheel and a must have if you really want to enjoy playing racing games. I don't think I can go back to playing a racing game with a traditional controller, ever.

One thing to keep in mind: a lot of the reviews you will read, no necessarily on amazon, come from former Logitech G27 owners who are seemingly angry with Logitech for not upgrading the software on their wheels to make it compatible with PS4. While I fully understand their complaint and I would be too if I was in their position, it shouldn't take away from how good the G29 is for PS4. My experience has been a pleasant one and I hope it will be as reliable as the G27 models that so many people seem to be fond of.

author: N20152016
title: Excellent Wheel
content: It did not work as expected initially with default settings in Project Cars.  Once I found the recommended settings in the community, it works like a real wheel.  It's excellent.

author: MTechAcc
title: Logitech G920 Repeatedly Disconnects from Xbox One
content:
Perhaps my Logitech G920 was defective, but it simply was totally useless when connected to my Xbox One. When I tried to use it with either Horizon 2 or Forza 5 it would start out working, but within seconds it would show as disconnected on the screen then the wheel would go through its auto calibration procedure as though one had just connected the USB cord.

It would repeatedly disconnect, calibrate, work for a few seconds then repeat the cycle again. I did connect it to my Win 7 PC and installed the latest firmware on it, but that didn't help. The only fix was to return it and buy the ThrustMaster TMX Force Feedback wheel, which works very nicely except for the light weight pedals that slide around the carpet all the time.

The Logitech G920 wheel seemed to be nicely built and stayed in place on the carpet, but the repeated disconnects from Xbox One made it unusable for me.

author: CalFire

author: Squatward
title: Gets a bit grindy
content: The wheel works wonders especially with the manual gearbox but it gets all noisy but honestly with headphones it’s a forgettable sound

author: Amazon Customer
title: everything was easy to set up and the settings were easy to ...
content: Bought this to use with Forza 7 on my PC. It's the first wheel I've owned so I can't honestly say that I'm experienced. However, everything was easy to set up and the settings were easy to adjust to my liking. My one gripe is the brake pedal. It supposedly has a "realistic" feel, but it's just way to hard to push. Sometimes the whole pedal assembly would pick up off the floor when I was mashing the brake pedal trying to stop. The wheel and pedals themselves are very nice quality. I especially like the metal shift "flappers." Things get pretty intense when playing online and I can say that this wheel handles some abuse. The clamps hold on tightly. Overall, I'm satisfied.

author: Cameron henderson
title: The best beginner wheel.
content:
The best wheel for the price. If you are just starting out and are using more games then sims like forza and F1, this is the wheel for you.

If you are looking for something more like iracing or another true sim, this is a little weak with the force feedback and the paddles are a little clicky and the brake pedal is too synthetic and hard to modulate. The clutch and gas have zero resistance and no feel.

author: Shelby
title: Not worth it
content: Sending it back want my money back an not happy

author: Steelo47
title: Mounting brackets didn't fit my table, Great wheel nonetheless
content:
This is a great wheel. Perfect for your beginner or average person into racing games.
The only problem I have with this wheel is NOT actually with the wheel.

Just be aware. Other than that I love this thing and recommend it

author: Eric A. Rodriguez
title: It was great, while it worked properly.
content: This may have been a bad batch. Mine worked great the first day. The next day of use, the wheel started making a loud whine, loud enough to wake up my wife. It still operated but the slight burned plastic smell and whine made me return it as I play, most of the time, at night. The previous night she said couldn't tell I was using it. I can't blame the seller or product, like I said probably a bad batch. However, as quality control seems to be a problem, this has opened my eyes to another product. The Fanatec systems.

author: DMac
title: Great Wheel and Pedal Combo...No Manual and poor Cust. Service
content:
The Logitech G29 Force Feedback Wheel and Pedals combination is great.  The force feedback really makes you work a little harder when playing a racing game.  It gives you a more realistic experience overall.  The pedals are very sturdy and give you a realistic feel when using them.  I have used a different wheel and pedal combo before and it was nowhere near as realistic as these are.  Even the Brake pedal gets stiffer the more you push on it.
Now my only complaint on this product has nothing to do with the operation of the wheel or pedals (to an extent that is).  When it arrived I took everything out of the box and checked everything out to make sure it was all there and nothing missing.  The thing that was missing was the operator’s manual.  There was only two sheet of paper that were in the box.  One showed what wires when where, and the other was the warnings page.  So I thought well maybe they have it on their site in a PDF like a lot of companies are doing now.  NOPE! I looked for almost a half an hour and stopped there because all they were doing was making me go around in circles (and that ticks me off).  So I then emailed customer service and the response I got back was “if you want to know anything go to our forum pages and look it up there”.  What the heck?
 I know it’s pretty straight forward on how to use it, but I thought there might be some settings or other things that could be of use. Nope.  So although it is a great wheel and pedal combo and works well, I am only inclined to give it 3 stars due to first: no operator’s manual, and second: VERY poor customer service.

author: Kimberli Guerra
title: Overall, can’t go wrong for the price.
content: Great setup, the pedals feel extremely durable, and steering wheel is well built. I also got the shifter with this and I love the stitching on there some much, feels cheap but for the price you get what you pay for!

author: Brant Fetter
title: Stop having your customers test your product!
content: Logitech should not claim or sell something that is not properly tested. I bought the G920 and it didn't function with PC (but did fine on my Xbox one, even though I've seen a lot of customers also have trouble with that too). I spent extensive time interacting with customer service and they informed me that I should just return the wheel and order a new one, since "it should work". After getting a second G920, I had the same experience with Logitech support recommending that I get another, but instead I ordered a Thrustmaster. Logitech is simply gambling. They develop and manufacture a product, and by doing minimal testing, they think they can claim their product works for both platforms, but in reality, there are either none or few that actually do. I know testing for PC is not easy, but don't bother making claims of PC compatibility unless you know it's going to work for 99.99% of the customers. I got the impression from Logitech customer service that the percentage of success is closer to 30%. The larger percentage of their customers that buy the wheel for Xbox are entirely oblivious and thus give a good rating. The PC users have real mixed results and end up acting as the unpaid testing department of misery.

author: HUgeneral
title: Great wheel!
content: This wheel is great! I have used this on several PS4 driving games (F1 2016, F1 2017, GT, Drive Club and more). Like a lot of steering wheels you do need to mess with the settings a bit first for each game but it is pretty basic stuff. Almost plug-and-play. Nascar seems to be a tad buggy, not really any settings for Nascar so you kind of just have to deal with it. That is on the game maker though not Logitech. The paddles and pedels  feel very well built, the peddles are a big improvement here from the G27. if you play games like F1, GT or PC the buttons on the wheel are a must, it really helps and is a great feature. Overall if you have a G27 and have the extra money to upgrade I would, If not the G27 works very well.

author: towanda1948
title: Great gift for a gamer.
content: Great Christmas gift for a gamer!

author: paul morrison
title: This IS the wheel to have!
content:
I'll start with packaging, the wheel and pedals are very nicely packaged to prevent scuff and scratches, on first opening the box I was very impressed with how well it is packaged. Now on to the wheel and pedals. I was previously using an entry level wheel by hori which is a good wheel for the first time sim racer and my expectations were far exceeded by the G29. First the wheel itself, The G29 is flawless in fit and finish, all of the buttons are very well thought out and placed in the perfect location for me, the leather wrapped wheel is extemely comfortable and the force feedback feels like a real vehicle, I race mostly in VR and the buttons are easily accessible without looking, the paddle shifters are velvety smooth and made of high quality stainless steel, the wheel has very smooth ball bearings and even the chassis of the wheel is made of metal.
 The pedals. The pedal set is also very high quality, the brake pedal gives a nice feel, the clutch is also very nice, not exactly the same as a real sports car but close. The pedals themselves have all steel construction underneath the plastic housing making them very solid giving you the confidence to really put your foot on the brake without the worry of damage. All in all this is a great wheel and pedal set. The pros and cons

Pros:
very well built
Extremely smooth operation
Feels very realistic
Force feedback
Looks fantastic

Cons:
The price
No included shifter like the G27

author: KingZazzzY
title: Five Stars

author: todd
title: Amazing wheel, must buy for xbox racers.
content:
I bought this wheel only for xbox one to play forza 6, horizon 2, and project cars. Works perfectly in all 3, just plug in and play. Haven't had a single problem yet, 50 hours played on it.  The light everyone says is to bright is no brighter then the T.V, i have no idea what they are talking about, pitch black room and you can stare right into it no problem. I also love the brake peddle and i keep the deadzone at 95%.

Bought the g920 instead of the TX because it was a $100 cheaper, 2 year warranty, and I've read that this thing will last forever.

Only downfall with this wheel is the helical gear motor, would be nice to have the belt drive, also hopefully Logitech will release a shifter that competes with the others.

author: TDT Gaming
title: Defective wheel
content:
Pros -
The pedals worked
Cons -
Wheel was defective
Customer support

I bought this wheel a while ago and all was well in games that didn't use more then 90° of rotation.  When you spend 200+ on something like this you expect it to show up in excellent condition since it was listed as new.  Once I hooked it up and started playing American truck simulator I went to turn the wheel and it activated every button.  Tried contacting seller about the issue but didn't get any response.  So I tried to disable all the buttons on the wheel itself and not even 20 mins later then thing started smoking.  I decided to take the wheel apart to see where the smoke was coming from and noticed the 7 pin connector had melted and synged all the wires. I noticed other buyers experiencing the same issue based off of older reviews but I figured they would have got some newer ones that wasn't defective based on the good reviews. Sorry for the rambling i just want to warn buyers about the defect in these wheels before you cough up the dough to get one.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: I love it

author: Amazon Customer
title: Once you have a great place to mount it, it is awesome

It was hard to get used to at first, but after a week or so I was back to playing FORZA 7 on unbeatable mode again.

author: Jason H.
title: A well made wheel for PS4 that manages to get it mostly right
content:
While this is an expensive set of PS4 controllers (wheel and pedals); you get some decent quality for your buck.

The Wheel:

Good size, all of the standard PS4 buttons (with four additional programmable if your game allows it), nice tension, and POWERFUL force-feedback.

The Pedals:

Solid design, good tension, nice base, light weight.

Overall:

Great wheel-and-pedal if a bit expensive. The forcefeed back is really powerful if the PS4 game can drive it...the strongest FF I've found was in F1-2017. The force-feedback in F1 on PS4 is strong enough to make the wheel very heavy to where my shoulder is fatigued after a race for two. There's a bit of play and looseness in the steering wheel and it's not as smooth as the more high-end racing SIM wheels. There also bit of a "grinding" feel as the belt works against the force-feedback that doesn't feel realistic and can be distracting; but it's about as good as you are going to get without paying nearly $1k for a professional sim controller.

My one minor criticism is with the C-clamps they use for the desk mounts. While the clamps are fairly strong and durable, they use a spring tension knob on top which doesn't lend itself to getting this thing really locked down. It's extremely frustrating to have this thing pop off in your lap while you are racing. I would have preferred if they had designed the c-clamps to use an allen-wrench or T-Knob so you can get this tighter. But it works with some effort.

My suggestion for use: take a gripping pad (or a glove) and wrench down the knobs on top as tight as you can get it. You can get the clamp pretty tight without breaking them, so use some muscl.. Additionally, I use a piece of double-sided carpet tape on the bottom-back area (where the cables come out) to give it a bit of extra stick to the desk. This helps keep the back end from lifting up during the race and adds a bit of rigidity to the whole thing. I'd also suggest adding some softer rubber feet to the bottom as the hard plastic ones will rattle your desk and annoy anyone who isn’t actually playing with you.

Other than that, my other criticism would be with the fact that they made the back edge of the pedal platform curved…which looks nice, but if you brace it against a straight surface (like a wall or desk frame), then the curved edge causes the pedal platform to rotate a bit.

Ultimately, to get the most bang out of this, you need a more permanent mounting solution (like one of the racing mounts); but it gets the job done and is a blast to use in game.

author: bryan lamoreaux
title: USED equipment, wont calibrate
content: Received what appears to be a return item. it wont calibrate properly with the brake. There are clear visual indications of wear from use.

author: Kyle
title: Plain and simply love this thing.
content: I stream with this thing 5 days a week and love it.

author: RAY D
title: Five Stars
content: AOK

author: Nick
title: brake fail
content:
Whoever thought it was a good idea to put this stiff of a piece of rubber in the brake should be fired. Pushing 120lb of force on the brake still only gets it to 90%. I heard cracking and hope it didn't break itself. It's the same stiffness as the clutch til 35% then it's just hard and useless. That's not how brakes feel. I don't want to void the warranty so I'm forced to use a pedal with 35% travel and set the deadzone enough to compensate.

The rest of the wheel is good. Good build quality. Looks good. Works good. There is the notchiness from the helical gear but I already knew that before buying. The paddle shifters have too much wiggle room and need a more snappy feel like real paddle shifters.

author: Steven
title: Amazing
content: Brought my racing games to life. I thought I enjoyed them before... it has now brought more depth and realism to the experience.

author: Tana Bonin
title: Not a happy camper!!
content: If you purchase this you will need the stand. Too shakes and uncontrollable.

author: Nicholas Gouldman
title: AMAZING!
content: Very high quality wheel i wish I would have bought it sooner! I absolutely love it!

author: ryan
title: Best bang for you buck experience
content: Really great product, be prepared to feel like you’re driveing a real f1 car, big rig truck,Baja truck,rally car, formaula one drifter, street racer, ect ect. Just make sure you buy or have a good stand or mounting bracket that can handle the daily prushing and pulling and twisting of the parts.

author: Sandy
title: Good
content: My nephew likes the present he got.

author: Daniel
title: Perfect
content: I play GT Sport 24/7 now.

author: terry wankel
title: Very precise
content:
I like the wheel.  I had previously used a thrustmaster t80 for sim racing and needed a force feedback wheel.  This does everything I wanted it to do.  The pedals feel great, although the brake pedal takes some getting used to.

The only thing I didn't like about the wheel was that the gear driven feedback is a little clunky at first on dirt tracks until you tune the settings top even it out.

Overall I love it and would highly recommend.

author: Todd Maniac Wilson
title: Quite Satisfied
content:
In summary:  Pure Awesome.

Using the G29 / Logitech Gaming G Driving Force Shifter with Assetto Corsa & Dirt Rally on PC - easy to set up, and the force feedback is amazing.

author: J. Estrada
title: Brake issues are real. Swerve around this turd.
content: Hated this product. The wheel is obviously quality; wrapped in nice leather and with a nice and heavy feel. The goodness stopped there as once you start racing (Forza 6) you realize the brake pedal issues other users write about is no joke. It was impossible to brake effectively as the pedal doesn't depress fully, and in trying to do so you push yourself away from the wheel instead. I adjusted the brake sensitivity in-game, but all that's really doing is turning the brakes into an on-off switch, not the precise tool that you deftly touch to achieve all the nuance Forza is known for. I saw some users remove a certain pad from the brake mechanism itself, but for $400 I shouldn't have to do that (and void the warranty in the process). How could this product be released without quality control? Buy at your own risk. It turned my favorite game into a chore.

author: leondres monroe
title: Awesome wheel
content: I love it for my full sim setup

author: Laurence
title: Solid Wheel, Bad Defect
content: These wheels are great.... When they stay functioning properly. As an "entry" level gaming wheel, I don't expect the highest quality materials, design, etc. but I do expect the product to be able to withstand normal day to day use. After literally a day of use, the steering wheel started making this terrible squealing/whistling sound when turning. After investingating online, it seems like this is a common problem with this wheel and Logitech hasn't seemed to address it. It seems there is a fix that has been posted on YouTube, but why risk voiding your warranty to disassemble the wheel? I'd rather not deal with this product all together. If you're able to get a wheel that doesn't have this product defect, it should serve you well as a good racing wheel but I don't think it's worth the $250-300 for a product that's defective after less than 24 hours of owning.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Two Stars
content: Configuration not 100% more difficult than for G27.

author: Greg Guzik
title: Great wheel
content:
I got this wheel for about $245 and feel it was an absolute steal. It's my first wheel so bare that in mind but I was blown away by how good it.  I don't regret my purchase at all and trust me I would if anything was wrong because this is the most money i've ever spent on video games.  There's complaints about the brake pedal.  I felt it too and it was a problem until I found out you can adjust the sensitivity in the options menu of all racing games. SO my advice is do NOT listen to anyone telling you to remove the cork or whatever it is in the break pedal.  Simply go to the options menu and adjust the sensitivity of your break.  For those that dont know people were complaining that it took A LOT of pressure to push the brake in all the way. SO much that you'd end up pushing your chair backwards before breaking like you wanted.  Its cuz of a cork that's in there so peope would open it up and remove it. But I didn't do that, I just adjusted the sensitivity of my brake in the menu and it works great.  The cork is great actually because you can slam on the brake in those crazy moments and it won't harm your pedals cuz the cork takes the force.
The one down side is that on Consoles you can only use the stick add on that Logitech sells.  Which is fine, I have it and it matches the wheel perfectly.  The negative part is that there's more expensive cooler shifters (about $150 ouch) that won't work with this wheel.  Who cares though right when it's that expensive.  The shifter that you can buy as an add on for this wheel is about $40 -$60.  So some might not even see it as a negative and see the more reasonable price of the shifter as a positive. I have it and like it but even if you don't you can always just use the paddle shifters.
