Pretty steep learning curve on the wheel with simulation steering. Buying any other wheel would be insane, the shifter add on is a must as well.

author: Gary Lucas

author: DannyB
title: SO MUCH FUN
content: This racing setup has brought me HOURS of fun. I was so surprised by how responsive and how well this thing actually works. There’s a pretty big learning curve and takes a while to get the hang of and get used too but once you do you will have SO much fun. Be patient because it’s a little tough at first but once I really learned how to race and drift with this setup I can’t pull myself away from the game. (Forza Horizon 3) You really have to grip the steering wheel when you’re driving because it moves, jerks and feels real when you hit bumps and hills and stuff. All in all this racing setup is a lot of fun and I highly recommend it. I would also recommend investing in the racing stand (in picture) because you can really bolt everything down and have a nice solid setup. Ever since I was a little kid I dreamed of having this exact racing setup in my house so needless to say I love it and I have a lot of fun with it. Good buy!

author: Katrina Vang
title: Highly recommend
content: Can't play Forza without it.

author: isosaf
title: Makes the difference in driving games
content:
Love it, but I'm already thinking of moving up again. I bought this on sale to replace my first wheel, a Thrustmaster T80. I was wearing out T80s after about 2 months. Fortunately the manufacturer stood behind them enough to send me new ones. I've had the Logitech G20 for over 6 months now and have had zero issues. I use this with a PS4, and my game of choice is GT Sport.

As for the force-feedback part of it, it is fun being able to feel the curbstones in the corners. It is even more fun when you feel, in the wheel, when the car gets light after cresting a hill. The pedals are much nicer than T80 set in that I get just a little "feedback" (not force-feedback) from the rubber bumper under the pedal. Some folks take the bumper out, but I left it in and rely on it. I can always press into it if needed.

If you are thinking about getting your first wheel, I think the G29 is great. The T80 may be half of the price of the G29, but it is not even a quarter of the quality and durability of the G29. That said, just having a wheel and pedals alone makes a big difference in game-realism over using the joystick controllers (and for me makes a difference in overall time). I was quite content with the T80 until it started failing, but I was also already wondering if force-feedback was worth the extra money (it is).

One star off only because the force-feedback, while very nice, feels a little gritty. I'm guessing the more $$ we spend, the more realistic and smooth they feel.

Can usually work around them, but it's after an hour of Googling/editing config files/etc....).  Other than that, I love everything about this wheel.

Getting it to work properly with some games can be exceedingly frustrating, but it's hard to differentiate whether it's the game itself being the difficulty or the wheel.

After buying the G29 and doing a bit more tech support googling and the like, I'd probably purchase the Thrustmaster T300 if given the choice again. Although I've been decently happy with the product, it's design does seem to be compromised where the T300 is a much more focused, quality product.

author: salma
title: Yes
content: My brother enjoys this very much

author: Jordan
title: An overall good product with one well known flaw
content:
Been wanting to get a good racing wheel for a long time. After trying to decide between this and Thrustmasters option I ending up going with Logitech based on great past experiences with their products (not to say Thrustmaster is bad I bought one of their joysticks for my dad for flight sims and he really like it). The quality is really great for this wheel, and I especially like the medal paddle shifters and pedals.The force feedback is taking some getting use to, but this is my first wheel (I usually play racing games with a controller). Mainly using this to play Project Cars 2 and Forza. I'm no expert but it works well for me, I'm really just trying to get over the learning curve of moving from a controller to an actual wheel. I did not pick up the shifter for right now. I think in the future I may end up getting a actual seat and what not since just playing in my office chair is not super comfortable based on sitting position.

Now this is beating a dead horse at this point, but I really cannot stand the break pedal, and that's because I have to literally stand on it to make it work. Seriously who at Logitech thought making it that stiff was a good idea. The break pedal in my own car isn't even that hard to depress. At the very least they should've made it adjustable. I may inevitably do the brake pedal mod but I'm torn because I don't really want to void the warranty. Seriously a big mistake on Logitech's part for doing that.

Overall, though, I'd still recommend this wheel. The good outweighs the bad

author: Richard G. Adams
title: Sublime Steering Wheel for PS4
content: Unboxed it yesterday and played Project Cars 2. Unbelievable feel at the wheel and great feedback with pedals. I absolutely love this item. Great value considering the pricing of the competition. I highly recommend this for PS4. When coupled with my Playseat Challenge racing seat, the G29 has made me a more competitive driver. Well done Logitech!

author: Avarre
title: Banshee wheel?
content:
The only real complaint I've had is that it started squeaking during left turns almost immediately. Honestly "squeak" doesn't really do it justice. It's kind of like a shrieking squeal. Like a dog whistle for humans. Right at the top of audible frequency. I had to take it apart and apply an electrically safe lubricant to one of the brushed motors that drives the force feedback. It's been working beautifully since then.

Other minor complaints: the pedal unit is a little too light to stay planted on carpet, even with the spikes deployed. The pedals are also pretty darn close together. You're not likely to hit the wrong pedal or anything, but you will find your shoes attacking one another during left foot braking.

Aside from that, everything else is great.

author: Ham Planet
title: An awesome way to get started!
content:
I bought this wheel (G29, the PS4/PC version w/o shifter) so I could get started sim racing, and was pleasantly surprised at how nice this wheel is. A lot of reviews mention the noise, which I won't deny. It did squeak quite a bit out of the box, but the squeaking died down with use. Be aware that this wheel gets hot with use, and will quickly heat a small room up. It's good for the longevity of the wheel to allow it to cool down after a half hour or so of use (same goes for your eyes). It's addicting and brutalizing at the same time: it really changes the racing experience. For the price, this is easily the single best entry level force-feedback wheel you can buy.

The one major issue with it is that not all racing or driving games will work with it. Mainly all of the PC racing games will work, so long as they're mainstream. Off the beaten path games may not have controller support. Be sure to check and see which games support it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: First time wheel owner.
content: Awesome first racing wheel experience. Very professional texture feel around the wheel and high performance steel racing pedals. Makes you feel like you are on the road. Forza 6 plays it very very well. Force feedback is right on point. Project Cars picks up this wheel right from the settings and even shows you a layout of the g920 right in the game to easily change buttons. Being I am a pc gamer as well is the reason I chose this one. I have previous Logitech projects so I plugged in the wheel and it instantly showed up in the list of active Logitech prouducts. I haven't played any racing games on my pc with this wheel but there is a driver and my Windows 10 machine did recognize it right away.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: It is awesome! Familiar with product as it is very similar to g27 i have.  I would recommend.

author: Josué Inces Cascante
title: A little bit hard at first but so much fun!
content:
I was so excited to finally play racing games with a wheel after so many years playing with a controller and what a difference!
The first time you put your hands on the wheel you can feel how well made this thing is and it might be a little bit difficult or even frustrating at first but after a few hours of playing and messing with the wheel settings for each game you will have a lot of fun and realism.
There are some comments about the brake pedal being too stiff and too hard to push it all the way down and there are even some tutorials on YouTube on how to remove the little rubber piece from that pedal but I wouldn’t recommend this because it will take away the “real” feeling of braking a true racing car and also could avoid guarantee or something. Instead what I would recommend is to adjust the brake pedal settings on each game for example on forza horizon 3 you can go ahead and decrease the deacceleration  outside setting all the way down to 20-25 and will be just perfect and you won’t take the risk of breaking your pedals trying to remove the rubber and also you will keep the realistic feeling.

author: Stevie
title: Good controller on its own, not much of an upgrade to the G27
content:
I own the Logitech G27 racing wheel and absolutely love it... best steering wheel controller I've ever used. This model is suppose to be an 'upgrade' to the G27, but I'm not too sure about that. First, despite costing nearly twice the price of the G27, the new G920 (and G29 for the Playstation 4) does not include the manual shifter. That's a huge disappointment for me since I love using the 'old style' shifting option. Logitech does offer the shifter as an add-on, but you have to cough up an extra $60.

Although the new design feels very familiar, the controls are vastly different. The G27 had three buttons on each side of the wheel that you can easily access with your thumb without interrupting steering, plus another eight buttons and control pad mounted on the shifter. The G920 basically has an Xbox controller mounted to the middle of the steering wheel. Although it'll probably be helpful for those who aren't familiar with the wheel, I personally don't like it, and much prefer the old-style thumb buttons over having an entire controller in your face. With the G920, I find that I have to move my hand to reach buttons, where the G27's buttons could easily be reached, even while turning, without moving my hands.

Aside from the buttons, I found no difference in steering control between the two models. Both wheels feel great and the force-feedback is fantastic, but I found no improvement whatsoever with the new wheel. The peddles also are pretty much the same, although the brake peddle seems a bit stiffer and more realistic compared to the G27.

On its own, the steering wheel is a fantastic addition to any game system... it's incredibly well built, feels like a quality piece of equipment, and offers an amazing experience for driving games. The wheel mounts easily and securely to my desk, and removes just as easily. Compared to the G27, it offers Xbox compatibility, but outside that, for me, there's really no reason to upgrade. I'm glad I have a good racing wheel controller for my Xbox, but for PC use, I prefer the G27... not to mention, it's half the price.

author: david s.
title: Best wheel I have ever owned
content: Best wheel I have ever owned, but you do need a sturdy table to mount it on or you'll be wearing your coffee!!! Logitech rocks, best products on the market!!!!

author: J. Weight
title: Love it!
content: I love this wheel and pedal set.  I've played with the toy wheels for a while (Microsoft wheel on xbox 360 and logitech wheels on pc before) but this is the first time I've had the real deal.  I've used it in about 60 hours of Dirt Rally and maybe 10 hours of Project Cars on the PC.  I have not used it on an Xbox One.  It has been 100% trouble free, and mounted great on the wheel stand pro I bought to go with it.  If you are going to try rally, you will definitely want the shifter.  For road racing the paddle shifters seem to be OK.  I especially love having the clutch pedal.

author: windell m. bolling
title: Great seller!
content: Description was spot on,shipping was on time,Price was great.

author: Anonym
title: VERY VERY good Quality
content:
The Steering wheel is very comfortable.
It’s just plug and play!
A small Tipp for better game experience: Download the Logitech Gaming Software.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Four Stars
content: Needs the stand, dont even try without one

author: BReal
title: It's "ok".
content: Did a lot of sim racing back in the 90's, and getting back into it again. The G29 was recommended to me by a friend. I wish I'd spent a little more and gotten something better. There are a few degrees of dead zone in the middle of this wheel, when you are in that dead zone, you get zero feedback from the car. The clutch pedal doesn't work either. While this is probably fine for "games", it's not very good for a simulator like iRacing. My advice is to save your money and get something a little better that is belt driven.

author: Amazon Customer
title: It keeps kids glued to it.
content: Great product!

author: Josue
title: Great over all
content: I use it with my Xbox one and it works great

author: Kevin W. Connor
title: Good hardware, short on documentation or support
content: Good hardware, short on documentation or support. Works with PC and Xboxone after several hours of cable adapting, patching and driver loading.

author: Jeff
title: Five Stars
content: Great wheel

author: Amazon Customer
title: Terrible
content: Don't waste your time if you plan on using this on PC. It doesn't work with Windows 10 at all. I was very exited to use this when I got it but when I plug it into my computer after downloading the Logitech Gaming Software it just starts the endless loop of blue screen crashes. Doesn't work at all literally crashes the whole computer the second you plug it in. Also apparently plenty of people have been having this problem but no fix from Logitech yet.

author: Idmoment
title: ... wheel now for 2 years and It still works great.
content: I have had this wheel now for 2 years and It still works great.

author: DS
title: Great steering feel.  An absolute blast!
content:
This is our first steering wheel and we are using it on a pc with BeamNG Drive, and Wreckfest.  Googled a few sites on the best configuration for the two games and set the wheel up accordingly.

The steering feel is very good and sometimes I forget I'm playing a simulator .  It is a complete blast to slide and counter-steer in Wreckfest.  The only downside as others have mentioned is the pedal set does slip around on the carpet.  Will need to attach to a rubber mat or something to keep it from sliding.  Otherwise, the pedal set is great, the gas and brake work well and the feel is realistic with the brakes giving good resistance.  I didn't purchase a stock shift and don't feel the need for it as the paddle shifters are huge and work great.

I saw the reviews for Thrustmaster before making this purchase decision, but there seemed to be durability/longevity issues with it, so I chose the Logitech instead.  Hope the Logitech lasts.  I am very happy with this purchase!

author: Niral Patel
title: Five Stars
content: Works great, still getting used to it

author: DJ
title: Wheel-y Great
content:
This wheel was exactly what I expected.
Unfortunately, I wasn't able to remove the plastic addition to the clamp for use with a bigger desk. The wheel look like leather but feels like paper (not a problem for me).
The paddle shifters on the back feel great and have a nice click.
Brake pedal needs some modding but otherwise I'm currently using the clutch for it.
Force Feedback feels great.

As for the games I play with it (ETS, ATS and FS), it greatly improved my turning and acceleration to emit more realization.

The XBox LED is bright, but not bright enough to cause me to block it.

author: Don Quixote
title: Very nice quality dirving wheel and pedals
content: This is a great addition to the driving games on our PS3 and PS4.  The pedals have nice feedback as does the wheel.  The games you play will make a difference on how well this setup works.  For example, this works perfectly with gran turismo.  My 10yr old son and I never really cared for the kart racing in the game before.  Now with this new wheel, we both love the karts.  It's almost as much fun as going to the go cart track in real life.  We tried it with Project Cars and it does work. However, it's very touchy and it makes it difficult to race.  Maybe I just need to get used to it.  I still love the quality of this wheel and I'm now tempted to get the gear shift, (even though you do have paddle shifters on this wheel).

author: Linda
title: It's... OK...
content:
I honestly don't think i received a product worth the money I paid for... It is lacking in so many details... I'll list them off...
- The "Leather" feels more like paper.
- The LB and RB triggers behind the wheel feel like they just came out of the metal cutter. The edges are a little sharp.
- The buttons are sometimes not very responsive, requiring multiple presses at times.
- The LSB and RSB buttons feel flimsy and cheap. They can break any second.
- The force feedback isn't too great. You can feel the grind of the belt as you turn.
- The break pedal is WAY too stiff! It requires a bit of leg muscle to work it. In tense situations of slamming the break, the foot pedal controller would actually tilt and flip backwards!!!
- The clamps need rubberized feet. The wheel has slipped twice on me now.
- That one LED is rather too bright.
- Needs its own power source... yet another outlet needed...

All in all, im pleased it was discounted by over a $100, this wheel is hardly worth $300. But it functions for the most part, and works well with Euro Truck Simulator 2. It just doesn't feel high quality at all. I'd recommend looking for a better wheel if you can afford it. If not, then this wouldn't be the worst option. I just hope it can last me at least 5 years...

author: StacyR
title: Five Stars
content: exactly as expected.  on time shipping.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great Wheel/Pedals For The Money
content: Picked it up for $268 brand new, you can't beat that price for what it is. Really awesome introductory wheel setup. If I could go back in time I would have purchased the one that comes with the gearbox. My only problems (and they're not real problems) is that the break pedal is a little stiff, and that you can feel the gears in the wheel (nicer wheels have motors with a belt which feels much more smooth). If this is on sale and you're thinking about buying one do it, for the money this setup is sick nasty.

author: Manuel
title: Changed gaming for me
content: The first time I tried it I was a little disappointed but then realized it was just the settings I was using in Forza Horizon 3 for xbox and after fixing that its been great. Ive used it in American truc sim and loved it there too. Find myself using it everyday and definitely made gaming a lot better for me.

author: Victor
title: Durability Issues
content:
This is my first experience in buying a steering wheel (pedals included). And in the 4 months (more or less) of owning it, my overall experience with it is ok, although there were many considerable negative experiences I've had.

Pros:
-Nice textured feeling on the wheel
-A stand under the pedals to help prevent unwanted movement
-Compatible for PCs and PS4s
-Confgurable buttons

Cons:
-Wheel starts squeaking everytime I turn it (After 1 month of usage)
-Plastic peeled off on 2 of the 3 pedals (after 2 months usage; had to apply tape to prevent further breakage)
-Blue stripe starts peeling off (after 3 months usage)
-Playstation logo popped off (was only held on by tape, so I reattached it)
-Dust magnet
-Clunky software support on PC
-Expensive compared to other competitors
-L2,L3,R2, and R3 buttons feel fragile

In short, durability, software, and price is what you might need to consider if you want to purchase the G29.

author: Darren Willis
title: Fun!
content: It was a little hard for me to get used to it, and after playing with the settings I think I got it done. But Overall! It’s awesome, hopefully I’ll be able to be driving a manual. Fun to play with and use

author: CJ
title: Can't go wrong with this setup.
content:
This is a very nice wheel and pedal combo for the price. It definitely does NOT simulate a real wheel, but for purposes of a racing sim it is realistic enough. It is well made, and feels like a sturdy unit. I sometimes get aggressive with it when playing, and it is holding up very well. Just note that you definitely need to mount it to something sturdy, or you can easily pull it off.

The pedals are also well made, but the base feels like a cheap plastic. It will not stay in place on hardwood floors, so you will need to come up with a way to hold it in place if you aren't putting it in a cockpit. The pedals themselves feel realistic and have a nice metal finish with rubber pads to keep your feet in place. The cables are long enough to reach to the steering wheel, and the power cable was long enough for my needs. The USB cable was not long enough, and I had to get an extender, but to be fair it is across the room from my computer.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I was surprised at how good the G920 is
content:
After using many other wheels including the G27, I was surprised at how good the G920 is. Worked great right out of the box. I was worried about the 'gear noise' & 'deadzone' other people have complained about but those two factors are very minimal. When racing and with a headset you won't notice them at all.
After hard mounting this setup is like a tank. No wobble or play at all in the wheel base or rim as well as the pedals.
I found new rubber mod in the brake pedal useless- the force required to go full braking with the mod was high enough to cause flex in my rig seat, and did not feel more realistic.
Only reason I can't give it five stars - the g-shifter isn't included like it was with the g25/g27.

author: Rio
title: I would like to kno if there is any possibility of a handbrake set up for this system
content:
This is a great product, feels great both on the hands and feet. Feed back is good, each car feels different from either front wheel drive to rear wheel drive. Steering is responsive....!!! But the only concern I have is that there is no SIM handbrake set up for this steering wheel!!!. I had a PS4 before this and had the the steering wheel set up for that and had the possibility of a handbrake set up. I changed to Xbox because most of my friends have that console, and I bought the steering wheel set up with the intention of getting the handbrake.

I see youtube videos of DIY, but can you tell me if there is any possibility of a handbrake system for this

I would like to buy one to have for a more realistic experience

author: Krupa Family
title: Great way to experience a driving game!
content: Purchased this for my husband's birthday and he absolutely loves it! He uses this when playing NASCAR Heat 2 on the PS4. It does take some time getting used to the adaptability and movement of the wheel, but overall great purchase!

author: Mary J.
title: Steering doesn’t work
content: It’s a very nice device except it doesn’t work. You can’t steer with it as soon as you start racing it turns left and even if you turn all the way to the right it does nothing

author: Churchy
title: Very fun and realistic
content: Seriously so fun.  Using it on PC. Forza 4 is a blast to play.

author: Joe Gabbard
title: A bit pricey, but nice.
content:
I bought the G920 mainly for American Truck Simulator, it's a very well built wheel the wheel itself is wrapped in leather, it has padel shifters and I have all the buttons mapped to various things in the truck like engine start/stop, turn signals, jake brake, raise and lower my third axle and attach my trailer or detach, the other buttons are camera buttons.

All in all its a very nice wheel and the pedals are very well constructed also.

author: Maz
title: Great fun for all.
content: We have had hours of fun using this set along with Grand Tourismo Sport.  At first I didn't think it would be used much, however I was wrong.  All the family use it, and since the game has both automatic and manual gearboxes you are able to change the gears of the car yourself or not.

author: Gerard v bourne
title: great value for the money
content: the material could be better feels cheap but overall good product. it does the job for the money and excellent pedals.

author: ChingLiu
title: Five Stars
content: balabala

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: Excellent

author: Tater
title: Great starter wheel.
content: GREAT entry level FF wheel

author: JT
title: Paddle Shift button poor quality. Does not work with "The Crew"
content: Left Paddle Shift button went bad in 4 months. I researched this and found it appears to be a common issue on this wheel. Also, does not work on some games like "The Crew" like Thrustmaster. I guess Thrustmaster emulates a PS D-Pad and will work. This does not.

author: UrbanSage
title: Great minus a flaw.
content: Bought this as a replacement for my G27. I like the buttons better, but the G27 seemed to have better force feedback. Overall I really enjoy this wheel, minus one small issue. The stitching leaves the material edge exposed and is rubbing where my right thumb rests on the wheel. I'm guessing I can resolve it fairly easy when I take the time, but it seems like an ugly flaw in such a pricey product.

author: Ron Kramer
title: Win10 on PC  more than I wanted to spend... but.
content:
Except for the day after it arrived it dropped about 15 bucks in price = (
I'm not that into racing games. My budget was 99.  So I ordered a (HORI) brand. It was NICE FEEL AND BUILD and had a horrible spring in the center that totally ruined the experience and didn't work with my game.

Against my better judgement (3X? as much) I ordered this and wow.  I can see the difference, and feel the difference.  It does seem over priced - but I dunno what all goes inside with the haptic feedback.  There just is no comparison to the cheaper wheel. The mount clamps are better, the size of the base is smaller, there is no centering spring!  I hate a DEVIL of a time getting it installed. It would not show up in logitech gaming software. I spend around 8 hours trying to figure it out - uninstalling software and drivers and finally figured it out.  I'm on PC with windows 10.  I tried it today on Asseto Corsa and was amazing.  Feel wasn't right, but with some in game tweaking of the advanced controls I got it setup nicely.

author: Andrew Stutz
title: I really like this wheel
content: I use this to play Forza 6 and while it took some getting use to vs the controller, I really like this wheel. I played a few races without the brake pedal mod and it was okay but the rubber piece had to go. Defiantly do the brake mod, it took 30 minutes some screwdrivers and some Alan wenches. this wheel is just fun, get it and you wont regret it!

author: Sarah
title: The tip of the cable came loose
content: its not been an year and the tip of the cable came lose. Anyway i can get it replaced?

author: Roman Pennington
title: Does not plug-and-play for PC users... BEWARE
content: I heard rumors that Logitech's driver/setup for PC users was glitchy and the rumors are true.  You get this package, there's no disks or drivers apparently to install, so you think plug-and-play right?  Nope.  Depending upon your version of Windows, you may find it's recognized by the OS but not by any of the software you're running.  I got this specifically to use with Project Cars and Truck simulator, but neither software recognizes the steering wheel as being installed.  After Googling, it becomes obvious that tons of people have this problem.  There may or may not be a bunch of extra steps you need to go through to get the thing working.  I have to assume most of the positive reviews are for people using controllers like the xBox.  Although I have no evidence this works any better on xBox, but I can attest, that if you have a PC, this controller does not work properly.

author: Jeffrey LaBollita
title: But the G920 has a much better brake feel than the G27
content:
it frustrates me that they do not make a wheel that works for both Xbox 1 and PS4, I had to buy a new wheel when my PS3 died and the Logitech G27 would not work on either new console. But the G920 has a much better brake feel than the G27, that I can not be upset with the new purchase.
It is also nice that all controls are on the wheel, where the G27 had controls off to the side on the shifter. A fantastic product, I am very happy.

author: Autumn Merwarth
title: Great Wheel
content: Wheel and foot petals are great. However, my husband did say the break pedal is a little stiff, so hopefully after more usage it will loosen up. Other than that he really likes it.

author: Keith Hamilton
title: Does NOT work on PC.  Good for Xbox One only.
content:
Works great on XBOX One, but not on PC.  On PC there is no mapping software to map the pedals.  Common problem once you start looking around the sim forums to troubleshoot.  My throttle pedal does throttle at one end and brakes at the other.  The brake and clutch pedals do not work.  There is no easy way to remap the pedals in the Logitech software or within games, without loading external mapping software.  So basically, to use this wheel on PC, everything needs to be mapped through a secondary software hack to make it work.  A racing wheel should have proper pedal mapping from Logitech.

I would not buy this wheel again.  In fact, the one I have is going to be listed on eBay soon.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Im buying a logitech g29, make sure the product
content: I am buying a logitech g29, please make sure the product im buying, otherway i want my money back

author: isaiah
title: Works great
content: Works good and fun to use.

author: Tony
title: great buy
content: The steering is strong and the foot peddles firm, I got it to use on my pc for ATS trucking game mainly and works for me.

author: Them
title: but other than that I love it!
content: The only thing that bothers me about the setup up is the brakes.the peddle is too hard and hurts my right foot after a while.but other than that I love it!

author: Noah
title: Awful product
content: DOES NOT WORK ON WINDOWS 10 DO NOT BUY IF YOUR TRYING TO USE WINDOWS 10. Logitech does not care about you if you are having the same problem I am having where nothing works. I spent 4 hours trying to fix this with countless methods. Nobody has helped me from Logitech. Do not buy this wheel. Don’t listen to people who say it works because it definitely does not work.

author: Akuma2k
title: Logitech Is The Grandmaster Of Racing Wheel Products
content:
I had a Thrustmaster T-80 and 300RS, the 80 didn't have 180 turn radius which is unheard of for a racing wheel when cornering is very vital in racing games and even with the force feedback the 300rs has it doesn't come fully assembled as one piece like the G29 does.  You have to screw the wheel onto the assembly but after awhile the grooves start to wear and tear and you start to lose control of your car when driving, then the control stops completely and after that the pedal set stops working not to mention the pedal resistance being very average.

My Thrustmaster 300rs died after only 3 months of use and I went back to Logitech and got the G29 (didn't even know Logitech made the G29 until I saw the update for project cars), I've been having a blast with the G29 and haven't had any problems whatsoever and the pedal resistance is awesome and the force feedback feels very natural and coincides with every turn and bump you encounter on the race track.  The G29 is well worth the money spent and your driving performance will definitely improve 100% switching from a controller to a racing wheel, i recommend this wheel to racing game fans because the quality of this product is 2nd to none and no one else comes close to Logitech when you talk about racing wheels.

author: mjsullivan
title: Won't connect to Xbox One
content:
Logitech G920 Driving Force Racing Wheel (941-000121)
Bought this to play Forza 6 on xbox one and it keeps failing to be recognized by the xbox one.  I've been able to get it to work a few times by plugging it into another usb port, but now I've tried to use it again and the light on the wheel keeps flashing, the buttons work despite the error message that it's not connected, but the wheel doesn't respond.  Sending it back, way too much of a hassle and I have a mac so there is no way for me to upgrade the firmware if that's even a potential fix.

author: Heather/Andre Pink
title: Wish we could exchange
content: Was very excited about this purchase of this product on sale. Unfortunately it did not work properly. I wanted to exchange it but the option was not given so we had to return it. I couldn't rebuy because the original price was too high. :(

author: Nikki
title: Buy this not the cheap one
content: Good wheel. I'm not that well versed but i did own a cheaper Ferrari wheel that was like 60 bucks, only turned 180 degrees and was overall terrible. This product was such a big step up i cant even explain. The price might be a little scary for a beginner but i definitely recommend saving up for this thing over wasting cash on a cheaper awful alternative .

author: john frye
title: Support only two Game Franchises for $400
content:
I took the leap and purchased this wheel to use with my racing games on my Xbox One.  The wheel was very easy to setup (plug and play).  The reason I give it only three stars is it only works with basically two games, the Forza games and Project Cars.  Thats right, basically two games for a $400 wheel and pedals without the shifter.

Here are the games it DOESN'T SUPPORT  Need for Speed, WRC, The Crew, F1 2015, Rock N Racing, Need for Speed Rivals and no new game support is even mentioned on the Logitech website.

I now basically have a $400 racing wheel to play with two games now and for the future.  If you want a really nice wheel with force feedback to play only with the Forza franchise this is it.  But if you want to be able to use with other racing games you are S*** out of luck.

Whatever logitech needs to do to work with other publishers to expand support they should do it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Pedals failing, after 13 months of use
content: Well after 13 months, the pedals are pretty much useless, they keep accelerating and braking on their own, and they have been bolted to a racing chair. If I knew it had a life expectancy of  13 months I would have looked else where.

author: Eric Leichliter
title: The best budget wheel for getting started.
content: Always looking to get into sim racing without breaking the bank. After using this for over 15 hours the build quality and immersion were excellent. The wheel itself is a bit smaller than a life size one but nothing to be concerned about. The brake was my biggest issue when I first got it but after a few hours of use the stiffness went away. I use this to play Dirt Rally on PC and have never had so much fun playing a racing game.

author: dominic amabile
title: awesome product
content: i liked the customization of it, i didn’t like the brake pedal it was super stiff

author: Tj T
title: This think works great for the money.
content: I am a huge racing fan and play a lot of racing games. This wheel has helped me go faster in the games and help give a real life feel when playing.

author: Lilfurbal
title: Great wheel
content:
This is a really cool racing wheel.  While I haven't used any other brands, this being my first, I can't compare it to anything else.  Using it in games like F1 2016, Dirt Rally and Project cars, creates for a very solid experience with plenty of feedback.

For each game I generally have to tweak the brake pedal to reach full braking power a little earlier as it is hard to fully depress the pedal.  It feels nice though, but games generally seem to expect you be able to fully depress the pedal to get 100% brake and that's pretty difficult to do.  Fortunately it's pretty easy to fix in each game.

author: Garth Kinser
title: Do not buy this wheel
content: This is an awesome wheel for about a month. This is my second wheel to brake, the first one let out a pop mid turn and the force feedback was gone so I had to get an exchange. Unfortunately my second wheel has gone out as well, no pop this time just went out. This is the most heartbreaking frustrating thing in the world it’s just pass return so I’ll just eat the cost. I will NEVER buy Logitech again. I am beyond upset at their product

author: Lucas C.
title: Great wheel for price
content: If you are looking for a good wheel with solid foce feedback, but don't want to spend a fortune, I would absolutely recommend this wheel. I bought the 920 a year ago to use for iRacing, and had it for almost a year when it had some glitch with it that was registering buttons. It was used and beat a lot, and even fell off my desk a few times, so not really any fault on Logitech. At my time of purchasing this, it was the same price as the 920 but usually its a bit more expensive, and here's why. The G29 has Playstaion buttons instead of Xbox, which isn't fantastic but also not a huge deal if you want to play games on PC, as most show Xbox controls in game. However it also has pretty solid LED shift lights above the center of it, which is a nice touch. In addition however, it also has 5 more usfull buttons, and a knob type button as well. Also located well to be able to be pressed while driving. It also has the LED light signifying that it's on at the top of the wheel, instead of on the face of it which blinds you if it's dark in your room which is what the G920 has, so that's nice. Overall in my opinion the blue center tape and buttons look cooler than the silver/white ones on the G920. It is compadable for PC, PS3, and a PS4 though i have only used it on PC as the only PS i have is a PS2. I have used it for iRacing, NASCAR Heat 2, NASCAR Heat 3, rFactor2, Project Cars, American Truck Simulator, NR2003, F1 2015, F1 2017, and Gravel and it works perfectly on all of them. Great first or budget wheel.

author: Brad Les Bergeron
title: Must have for Forza fans racing games.  All my friends just love this experience.  Clutch is a must.
content: I love this Logitech Xbox wheel.  I use it for windows 10 PC for Forza games and Asseto Cars in VR but that’s a older game and clunky.  The wheel is awesome and force feedback is great.  My only complaint is that it doesn’t get tight enough on my game table and the break is hard to push but I hear there is a hack fix for it but it involves taking it apart.

author: Ilene
title: quality
content: The wiring of the wheel has broken and can't get it to work! very disappointed

author: U.S.Marshall
title: A peripheral device is only as good as its software.
content:
Tried the wheel with multiple games. The wheel is okay....After trying it, I can say that the wheel is not worth it at this price point. I might buy it again if it cost about 100$...and included the stick.

 Didn't have an issue with the brake pedal being super stiff, you can just have the software adjust the percentage of the pedal that you use. So instead of 100% of the depression distance, only use 50%. You can do the same for the accelerator if you desire. The wheel itself feels pretty good and has a fair amount of buttons if you want to play any Need For Speed games that use extra buttons for deployables.

 On the other hand, the software (for windows 7) is terrible. At random times during gameplay, the wheel would suddenly (without hitting anything in game) pull to the left or I would have to setup the software again. You also are not able to assign a key press to the pedals (unless the game already has a profile setup for that), so if you want to assign 'w' to the accelerator, good luck.

author: RB
title: ... to the racing wheel craze but this thing is awesome right out of the box
content: I'm new to the racing wheel craze but this thing is awesome right out of the box. I got this and the shifter and mounted them on the Playseat Challenge and it works wonderfully on Forza Horizon 3 and Forza 7.

author: Jules
title: Quality
content: Works great

author: Amazon Customer
title: Squealing while turning left.(Widely known Issue)
content: The wheel won't last this was my 2nd attempt at getting it and they both started squealing while turning left to the point the sound is picked up over the headset I've got 2 friends who've had no issues but I have got the short stick both times :/

author: Rodney L Ferguson
title: Best wheel and pedal combo
content: This is the best steering wheel and pedal combination. Also, I had a problem setting it up when I first got it. I contacted tech support and they got back to me with the fix right away.

author: Anthony C.
title: Fantastic from arcade to realism driving!
content:
Very responsive and awesome product.
Once you fully configure it, you will have the most tailored driving experience.
I added the shifter with it and it is terrific.
Force Feedback: pretty brutal at the beginning, once you are use to it and you smoother your driving style you will feel every single movement of the car.
On the wheel controls: just a Xbox one controller so well placed and easy to use.
Shifting paddles: nice to catch on straight lines you will be challenged during corners.
Pedals: gas great, clutch easy, brake a little bit hard but I like it.
USB cable: I would enjoy 1 or 2 extra feet...

author: Anon
title: Five Stars
content: this thing is fun. Wish the pedals were spaced out a little more though.

author: Julia Schwyhart
title: Bought for my 23 yr old son...he loves it!
content: Bought for my older son, it's pretty neat!!!!  I tried it out too.  Well worth it!

author: thiago c
title: Very good
content: Very good ! O loved it

author: Schuyler Wright
title: EPIC!
content: Works great and makes racing games so much more fun!

author: Bao Le
title: Great wheel and pedals
content: Really awesome wheel and pedals.  Very responsive and strong force feedback.  This is much better than the Thrustmaster T150.

author: Joe Ogg
title: I wanted to like this, but the software locked my wheel
content:
I wanted to love this thing, i was spending over three hundred dollars on it.

It feels good, my first racing wheel. I honestly wasn't that good by for Euro truck simulator 2, it worked fine. Until the driver crashed and the forcefeed back locked the wheel to the center. I tried uninstalling and reinstalling everything, restarting my computer, hard reset the wheel, take the pedal off, turning the FFB on and off, playing with the calibration which did absolutely nothing other than show that if I threw my back into it, I could still turn the wheel through it all.

The pedals, the brake was stiff as hell like everyones saying, that's all true. It's a pain to even brake, I just turned it down to half and it got around to it.

I paid three hundred dollars for this, I am not dealing with any of the garbage for that much money. It's software too, unplugged, it works fine. Turns fine. It's all Logitech software side, so I can't just send it back to get a replacement, it'll just be the same deal. So I'm now attempting to get a refund. By the way, the box is made of trash, it rips at a teasing touchs and falls apart like the trashiest Pizza box, no, pizza boxes can handle at least two pounds. This thing was falling apart the moment I took it from the shipping box.

author: S. Han
title: Not bad, but not great either.....
content:
This is my initial thought on the g29 as I just received it last night and have played it for couple of hours.  So far its just an ok wheel for me.  I am coming from g25, and have used thrustmaster T300 rs (a friend of mine has this one)  First of all I will not be taking out a star (or give one star) cause Logitech wont update their g25/27 driver to work with ps4.  As much as I am pissed about that too, its just business ppl.  live w it. At the end its all about money if you run a business.  I don't care what company, they are all the same. So live with it ppl, we can bitch about it all we want but don't give it a one star when this is suppose to be a review of the product.  We are here to help others to choose the right product.

soooo... why the three star, you ask..... cause for the money, its just an ok product for me.
First, lets start with what you get for the money, or to be exact, what you don't get.  The god damn shifter should've been included for this price.  so I took off half a star.  I don't care what Logitech says.... they took it out cause more money and ppl will still buy it.

Second, the paddle shifter.... its so god damn mushy. it has no click feel to it..(Hey, Logi, if you are not going to include the shifter, at least make your paddle better)  My g25 has better click feel then this. what were you thinking Logi.... Thrustmaster def has better feel on this department too.  So another half star....  If you are an auto only person, then this shouldn't matter...

Third, they really need to make their steering wheel bigger.  Never realized this until i tried my friends Thrustmaster.  Also the button lay out is not the greatest.  the L2,R2 buttons are too close to the center and just over all too many buttons. Maybe I will get use to it as I use it more.  No star taken off.

Forth, and this is my MAIN COMPLAINT,  the force feedback and the knocking noise.  Let me start off with the noise this motor makes... WTF!!!! seriously....W....T.....F......... clah,clah,clah....da.da.dadadaaddaadadada....clank..  "shuuuuut uuuuuuppppp!! I JUST WANT TO PLAY!!!!!! BAHHHHHHHHHHHHHH"  CLANK, CLANK....PAPAPAPA DA. DA. DA. DDDDDAAAAADAAAAAAA.. enough said.
now, the force feedback.  May the force be with you... did you see what I did there? hahaha...... sorry..........  So its not so much about the force feedback itself.... it has plenty of that when you are turing your wheel.. more turn = more force... good.  The problem is that theres no force in the middle.  you feel no connection (no FFB) for the first 5-10 degrees on each direction.  Now this might not be a problem if you only drive slow cars in the game... but when you are driving fast cars.. man oh man..... (In this department Thrustmaster has it down) Another problem I have is that the wheel comes back to the center too slow.....  I tend to let go of the wheel(on certain situations) on a tight turn so the wheel will center it as im passing the apex of a turn, as this gives a better, smoother wheel turn. (like I said, not all the time.. and if you don't know what im talking about, you aint gonna get it.. ;)  )  Problem w this wheel is that first, it returns too slowly (my g25 turned back faster) and second, once its back its hard to keep it straight as theres no force in the middle causing the wheel to turn slightly but enough to mess up a smooth exit.  So one full star off

Now you would ask me... "Hey, then why not the TM T300?  It seems like it has better force feedback and its cheeper, has a better wheel size, buttons are not clustered, you can take out the wheel(don't care about different wheels, easier to store) according to you"  ..... well two things.... their pedals are garbage but most of all it seems like they have an issue w the wheels, where they fail a lot and its a known issue. (well I'm judging by ppls reviews...) and I don't want to fork over 300+ for something thats going to break in few months... (and it seems like its a nightmare to get a hold of TM for customer service.)

The wheel and pedal def has better build quality then TM and looks cooler(?) but as of now its just an ok wheel for me. Especially for this price.  and no, don't tell me to go buy a 1000 dollar wheel.  Oh and that stupid led lights for sifting point?? yeah... that bitch is too small and located too low, you aint going to utilize it.  I'll just look at my screen thank u very much.

Hope this review helped... like I said it's not a bad wheel, its just average.

Update: (Feb 22nd 2016)  Been using this wheel for a while now..... and its still an ok wheel.. Logi really needs to scale up the steering wheel size.  and I have mixed feelings about the new brake feel... I know they advertise as better/ more realistic brake feel but it just feels a bit odd for me... the travel distance is too short  and when it gets close to the limit the brake feels really mushy. (very subjective....)  and that god damn deadzone in the middle is really annoying.. and yes.. the motor knocking sound is still annoying too.  So yeah........ this will prob be my last logi wheel I buy...  (so far I have played drive club, crew and project cars on ps4, no pc so far)

author: Amazon Customer
title: I love it.
content: I love it..it work fine on my Windows 10 I had problem for a min trying to set it up but over all I like the steering wheel and  paddles and shifter so far great  product!!😊😊

author: E.Christian B.
title: Good but not the best
content: force feedback is a bit week compared to other wheels I have had. pre-drilled holes for mounting is nice.

author: NewoOwens
title: Slightly dissapointing after it stopped working, to say the least.
content:
Died shortly arrival. First it began behaving erratically. After that, it began disconnecting and going "off center" while I was driving, resulting in much confusion and multiple system restarts so the wheel could "calibrate."

After that, it started only calibrating correctly occasionally. Otherwise, it would sit there twitching with the LED RPM gauge fully lit and the light on top flashing.

Mind you this is only after using with light force-feedback settings.

I've placed a call to Logitech and they have assured me they will fix it, but that doesn't really fix the fact that I blew a significant portion of my graduation money on a gift for myself that I may spend the first several weeks of summer fixing. The guy on call told me that the G29's have been having an issue like what I am experiencing, so I wouldn't recommend buying it if you are dead-set on using it within a week or two after it arrives.

author: Adam Silva
title: Works Perfect
content: My son likes the steering force feedback and is enjoying this!

author: Tim Montgomery
title: Great quality!
content: Very happy with this. A breeze to set up with all the games. Strange numbering system for the buttons, but what the hell ;)

author: Salvador Canales
title: Five Stars
content: Excellent service and awesome product, I really enjoy it.

author: Tyler M.
title: At first, I really did like this.
content:
I've always been into racing and having a little racing simulator at home just seemed like something that would be awesome!

And don't get me wrong, this thing is very fun and I still use it. I bought this specifically to play Forza on Xbox One. Bought it as soon at Forza Horizon 3 came out. It is fantastic for that game. It really is a good time, driving is easy and fun. Hint, use 480 degrees turning on the wheel setting for video games. 900 degrees is just too much.

The pedals feel like a real car, the gas is light and easy to push, the clutch is medium and the brake is hard. The shifter does not feel like a real car at all. I can shift into any gear by literally flicking my finger at the shift knob. I wish there was more weight to it. Also, in today's day, most cars have more than 6 gears. This shifter only has 6 so if you are playing with a car with more gears, you are out of luck.

The steering wheel is ehhh. It does not feel like a real car at all. The steering wheel is soooo tiny and not even close to a real car and the force feedback is weird, it just shakes the steering wheel. Doesn't have a "real car" feel even a little bit.

The thing that I really like about this wheel is how much fun it is to play on arcade racing games like Need for Speed or Forza Horizon. Once you get into the real racing sims like Forza 7, it is nearly impossible to drive. I use a controller on that game cause the steering wheel is so unrealistic and hard to use that it is just not fun.

If I were going to buy another racing sim, I would honestly save more money and get the Fanatec setup. It's such a better experience.

author: Brad
title: Great racing wheel
content: Solidly built racing wheel and it works great!

author: joe jensen
title: its a great price point for a wheel
content: its really great quality

author: Relax I'm God
title: Two years deep of abuse
content: I have over 1000 hours in with this wheel. Every moment was worth it. The belt system inside is not even worned out and still strong. Every use it still calibrates and works brand new every time. If you want to train to be a race car driver this is the tool you'll need especially in this technology age. Logitech also makes real life formula 1 wheels. Definitely and highly recommend it. If you have no passion in driving. Don't get it

author: Margaret
title: LOGITECH Diving Force G290
content: My grandson LOVES this gift.  He actually put it together with the stand and shifter by himself.  Downloaded what was needed and linked it to his xbox.

author: Alex
title: Great product, very well made.
content: It’s very nice, very customizable.

author: 15anthony15
title: Good starter wheel; you should get this if you aren't sure about other brands or the technology
content: This is a fine wheel. It provides you feedback. You can tune it. It does everything you want and beyond an arcade wheel. Had run using it on sim games from Dirt Rally to iRacing. No problem at all thanks to Logitech brand backing it. Supported by all games and was easy to setup. If you do not trust Thrustmaster brand vs Logitech backing, or belt-drive vs gear-drive, go with this. If you really think you are passionate about it (which I doubt), you sure still can return this and upgrade. Pedal that came with it was a bit stiff on break thanks to the loadcell, but I just remap the clutch to break to fit my soft break taste.

author: Brian
title: Great product great price

author: Jonathan Jaumot

High pitch squealing everytime I turn the wheel like metal is rubbing the whole way around from left to right. It gets annoying, and hurts mine, and my dogs ears. It's like a dog whistle, and wish I could find out how to make it stop. Been making that noise since day one, and its been a month now putting up with it.

author: Amazon Customer

author: garth k.

author: Freakonforfatty
title: Great Wheel. Poor Brake Pedal
content: The wheel itself is well made, high quality materials. But unfortunately, mine came with a stiff brake pedal, which resulted in a poor racing experience. I tried tweaking the settings for each game, but the pedal would not work as intended, to the point that I had to make the hard decision to return the wheel. It's too bad, I was looking forward to migrate from a game pad to a more realistic experience.

author: Volt
title: Not worth it at $400 (+ $60 for shifter).
content:
I bought this for $400. As of now typing this review it's $300. That's a 25% drop of price in just a week of purchase. So my rating/review reflects this too.
For $400 (+$60~ for the shifter)...It's a rip off. For $300 (+$60 shift) still high but at least reasonable/cheaper against its competition.

--Brakes--
Only using this wheel for Forza 6. First time diving into a corner with the wheel...NO BRAKES!!! Literally NO BRAKES! I have no idea why would Logitech think this is "ACCURATE BRAKING FEEL" per say on their web. Heck I never raced Pro Open Wheel, or in a Hydraulic Pedal operated machine, but damn you can skip leg day with this. Mad respect to real professional drivers if there brake pedals are this hard or require this much strength, or heck even with drivers that drive with no vacuum, and brake boosters.

So with the BS brake pedal. I removed the rubber stopper inside the brake assembly. AND GOD DAMN! MUCH BETTER. Pedal feel is like kart pedal feeling. Initially stiff, and then light, and then stiff again when nearly fully depressed. Not brick like with the rubber stopper on. Cars I owned has a brake pedal .3-.5inch play, and LIGHT. As you depressed more, resistance builds up (real brakes).

--Wheel--
It's nice. The button controls are in the wheel. So no need to use a controller to navigate. My Forza 6 Settings feedback is at 40, and vibration at 15 (not sure if wheel thing). Going through a apex stripes. Feedback disappears at this settings though. I left at this settings because this is the weight am used too (real). Also caster settings actually effects the wheel too, very nice.

--Table Clamp--
It's plastic, and holds well to the table.

--Pedal Floor Grip--
I have hard floors, and it slides as you repeatedly depressed the pedals. Then you will need to pause the game or slow down (multiplayer) to readjust. Best to leave a heavy book in the back, or a fixed stationary object behind.

--Shifter (Purchased Separately)--
$60...Toy like, and VERY short throw. Better than the Fanatec CSR Shifter Set.
(My personal preference. Not really into VERY/SUPER short throws.)

In conclusion if I purchased this at $300 (including Shifter). I'll be happy. However paid $460, and need to do some DIY (brake pedal). To make this usable. Not worth it.

If I only saved an additional $150~, and waited. I would have gotten the Thrustmaster. Thrustmaster has better steering feedack, better pedal feel (brake still stiff), and the shifter is very sturdy.

author: Mike A
title: Five Stars
content: Perfect for the beginner to iRacing or whatever sim you chose.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Four Stars
content: Yaaaaaas

author: Raul
title: Amazing!
content: Amazing!!

author: SF
title: Great
content: He loves it

author: Squiggy Wigginz
title: What a waste of money.
content: Not worth any money. I'd wish I had bought the thrustmaster wheel or fanatec for about the same price. We actually burned this wheel the other night in my fire pit. $400 not well spent and do NOT recommend for anyone driving a driving sim or game. This wheel should only be used by the people who created it to lose. It is not a good wheel and waste of money.

author: Amazon Customer
title: You get what you pay for... and that's not a bad thing.
content:
It's my first FFB wheel. It's excellent fun in games and does what I expect... however there's a few issues.
Let's start with the pros!

TL:DR: It's a great wheel and the best for value however you can sort of feel where the higher end options may be better. For most everyone besides extremely serious sim racers this is an amazing wheel and I'd definitely recommend. And for the sim drivers out there, $1,000 direct drive wheels are the way to go.

Edit: The sound has gone away after some use of the wheel. Probably just needed to be broken in

[Pros]
- Decent build quality, pretty durable (it's only been a few days)

- Competitive price. The Thrustmaster equivalent is a few hundred dollars more depending on where you look (I got this wheel for $200 on sale... thrustmaster equiv. is ~$500)

- It works... pretty well at that!

- Great clamping system!

- Great feeling pedals (with the exception of a small thing mentioned in the cons)

[Cons]
- An infernal screeching noise when turning the wheel to the left... lack of lubrication? This issue has been reported by a handful of users as well (I may request a replacement)

- I needed to do a quick mod to remove some tiny little stopper on the brake pedal that only allowed for maybe an inch of travel. This, and a shifter mod, are supposedly the most common things and a majority of people opt for this... annoying but it took only about 25 minutes and a simple screwdriver

- Since it's a gear driven FFB system there's (very very minor) inconsistencies in the feedback- little jumps sorta... and again with this gear driven system, it's kinda slow to turn from left lock to right lock. For basic racing this isn't even noticeable, however if you plan to drift or do rallycross I suggest investing in belt driven or direct drive (these options cost an arm and a leg)

author: Sam B
title: Do not buy: hardly ever works
content:
I read the reviews, and picked this wheel out to play with Project Cars 2. Sometimes it works, and it was pretty good when it worked.

But more more usually, when I turn the game on to play, everything seems to go fine until the game starts. As soon as I start loading into the track, the wheel goes limp. You can still use the buttons to start the game, but after that, the wheel is 100% totally unresponsive to any input. Until I use the keyboard to exit out and try again. Then, I troubleshoot the device for an hour, always thinking I've almost figured it out. After all, I've spent a significant amount of time reading about problems on the internet and the common solutions. And sometimes the solutions work. Plugging and unplugging USB devices. Calibrating the wheel. Clearing settings and reloading. Restarting the computer. Trying other power outlets. Unless you want to waste a minimum of 50% of your time getting this wheel to work, find something not made by logitech, and buy that. You might get lucky and get a good wheel. But if you're like me, you are not patient enough to return a wheel once you have it. Just buy something else.

author: Get Outside
title: It worked great for a month and then all of the sudden ...
content:
Don't but this, I bought one of these on August 31st, just before Forza 7 came out. It worked great for a month and then all of the sudden it wont connect to my computer. Logitech support has been silent so far... Go with something else!

Update, the power cord was loose. It is now working properly!

content:
This is definitely one of the lower grade racing wheels you can ever buy. I bought this primarily to play formula 1 and this simply does not match up. The mappings are horribly wrong, the force feedback is below par for product at this price.  The two stars are for quality of the materials on just the wheel. The pedal unit is a tad bit light and so quite often it will slip depending on the floor surface. So in the end I returned and swapped it for the Thrustmaster T500 which is way better than this one. Also note that with the T500 one can always add-on the Ferrari wheel.
Overall given my experience with this I do not recommend this for Formula 1
