author: Jonathan
title: Like driving a REAL vehicle
content: I drove a van like my work van, in Fonza.  It felt exactly like driving my van (2017 chevy transit).  Love it!

author: D. Burke
title: Seems pretty great
content:
I can't speak to the long-term durability/reliability, but my initial impressions are:
- Quality is fine (yes there's plastic, but the grip is good, the buttons work fine, and it doesn't feel cheap to me).
- The brake pedal bushing that everyone complains about is a non-issue, in my opinion; the pedals work fine without any modifications, and my games let me adjust the progression anyway.
- I'm mounting it to a glass desk that is barely more than 1/4in thick, and there are no mounting issues.
- The pedals are sitting on the floor (carpeted) without anything to secure them, and they haven't slid around once, even when I mashed the brake.
- I installed the Logitech gaming software (from their web site) to customize the buttons, etc., and it's fine.

I'll update this review for durability when it breaks, or in 1 year, whichever comes first.

author: Ryan
title: Great starter wheel
content: For the price it's great

author: David Calhoun
title: I love it
content: I love it

author: William D Allen
title: Awesome Wheel for Forza
content:
I switched over to the G920 from a G27 because I wanted to be able to play Forza 6 with a wheel and pedals. It is nice that the G27 shifter works with the G920, so I did not have to purchase the separate shifter. The new brake pedal resistance feels a lot more like a real brake pedal than the G27.

I had watched a review that compared the G29/G920 to the G27 that actually showed the G29. I did not notice that there are no rev/shift indicator LEDs on top of this wheel like there are on the G27 and G29. I'm assuming that this is because the feature is not supported by the XBOX One, but it would have been nice to have them included for PC games. I suppose this means I'll be using my G27 wheel and shifter with the G920 pedals for PC games now(assuming that the G920 pedals will operate properly with the G27).

The reason I'm giving 4 stars instead of five is that I am annoyed at having to purchase this, when it is nearly identical to the G27. It's also basically the same as the G29, but you have to buy "that one" if you want it to work on PS4. Controller/accessory licensing on consoles has gotten out of hand. Not a Logitech issue, but it is still an issue. It would be awesome if Logitech could start selling the wheel alone, with or without the motor assembly, since that is the only real difference.

author: Benjamin
title: it's been awesome. Leather steering wheel is nice
content: Once I got this working, it's been awesome.  Leather steering wheel is nice, and the pedals are pretty responsive.  First time buyer of a wheel and pedals, and I've really enjoyed it.  Knocked a star off because I had major issues setting up initially (weird driver issues, was blue-screening when i plugged it in).  But, once I went to Logitech's website and downloaded their utility it cleaned up the drivers and worked fine.  The other main issue is that the clamps sometimes come loose from my desk, but that may be more of my desk being an issue than anything else.

author: Candace
title: Brake Pedal Fix
content: I had heard about brake pedal problem on the G920 but not on the G29, and so I contacted Logitech about it. I was told the pedals on the 29 & 920 are the exact same. So I bought the G920, lo and behold the brake only had about 50-60% use/travel. I opened up the pedals (~16 screws & a 6mm allen wrench/10mm box wrench) and found a 1/2x1/2x15/16" rubber bushing in with the pedal spring. Seeing that the full pedal travel is 1 & 1/2" and the bushing is 15/16", it's easy to see this bushing is the cause of the problem. Improvement suggestion, remove the bushing and have a fully functional product.

author: Amazon Customer
title: !Worth the money!
content:
Works great , the addition of force feedback takes driving games many steps closer to the real thing over using a regular controller!
Used with GT sport

author: Cthulhu
title: New and slightly improved
content:
I happen to be the VERY happy owner of Logitech's Driving Force GT (purchased from Amazon in May, 2008 for $130). I am still using it with the PS3 because it's so awesome but, sadly, it's not allowed on the PS4. So, enter the new and slightly improved G29.

Besides it being compatible with both the PS3 and PS4, the improvements, when compared to my old GT, other than the vastly higher price include:

- Clutch pedal and the pedals are much nicer because of chrome
- RPM/shift indicator LEDs which are Okay but when racing I can't say that I look at them much and there's no stick with this wheel unless purchased separately
- Dual motor force feedback which is probably a good thing but the feedback seems to be the same of the GT so, Okay
- PS4 controls other than the touchpad are on the wheel vs. PS3 controls on the GT

Other than that, the G29 acts on the PS4 (and PS3) more or less the same as the GT does on the PS3. The steering wheel is slightly smaller but it's still nice leather and the pedals board is, of course, larger, because of the third pedal. Grips to the table and to the floor are okay. I was able to attach the wheel to our old, GT-compatible driving seat without a problem but the pedals board was more difficult because the Velcro bands used on the GT do not attach so well on the back of the G29 but we made them work, sort of.

I am somewhat disappointed by this model (same as GTs) abundance of wires and lack of any meaningful wire management. There's a wire from the wheel to the power brick, then a wire from the power brick to the electric outlet. Then, you have a wire from the pedals platform to the wheel body. Then, there's the USB wire from the wheel to the PS4 and if you are going to buy the stick there's going to be a wire from the wheel to the stick. If the Dualshock controllers can be wireless, perhaps the Driving Force which is basically 'a controller' could be wireless too. At this price, it's not such an unrealistic expectation.

Now, for the driving experience, it's still great. Sadly, there is no Gran Turismo on the PS4 yet and Drive Club has great graphics but it doesn't come close. However, it feels great to take a car on the road with the G29. I don't believe that it's such a great improvement over the GT or the other like models that Logitec made for the PS3 and I would have used the GT on the PS4 if it was compatible but, things being the way they are, G29 it is. Hope the price comes down. A lot.

author: CO
title: Great Wheel. A tad bit expensive. But well worth it.
content: Great wheel, it's a little expensive but definitely works. Had a little trouble at first while playing American Truck Simulator but that was just my inexperience in technology. Definitely recommend for everybody.

author: Tim Miller
title: Awesome wheel
content:
Pros: looks awesome. Feels awesome. Force feedback is near perfect. Perhaps a belt would be better and feel smoother but it has A LOT of force with the gears which is great. I suggest tuning it in game. The wheels turning radius is awesome and what's best is all the extra buttons. I do iRacing and use them for various commands.

Cons: the price and lack of customization. The customization doesn't matter as much but that's where thrustmaster wins over this. If the price came down to $200 I'd say it's fair.

author: Piedma Schwartz
title: Nice wheel.
content: Great wheel. My only complaint is that the usb cord is a little too short.

author: KiwiTexan
title: Really good
content: Wicked fun and surprisingly realistic especially when paired with Forza 7.

author: R.G.
title: Not worth what it costs. Lower the price and I'm sold.
content: If you want a realistic racing/drifting set up, for the love of god do not order this!!! I love Logitech, but this is honestly a flop. If it was cheaper, I would say it's worth it. At the price point its at, the quality is inexcusable. I read a lot of reviews saying the pedals are too stiff. I thought maybe it was just a manufacturer error on some units. Boy was I wrong. The desk clamps slide so much that when you turn the wheel to correct an oversteer it flings off your desk. The wheel is tiny. The default feedback is too much to handle. I feel like I'm going to break it if I push against the force of the feedback gears. I'll be returning this.

author: Adli A.
title: The adjustments are key for the best experience
content: The pedals overall were okay but the brake pedal wasn't tolerable, too stiff and unrealistic, found a video on YouTube that you can remove a little rubber piece inside it and it was a lot better. The wheel, on the other hand, is a little too small. I had to make a few adjustments in the game to get it somewhat where I felt comfortable, I kept spinning around in the game but I guess it takes time to get used to.

author: Matthew B.
title: A very good starter wheel, good time to get once Direct Drive wheels launch.
content: This review is on about a year of ownership, playing on a regular basis. First, Please make sure you have Logitech gaming software downloaded onto your PC before buying. This is how Logitech updates your wheel and provides drivers for most racing games. This wheel is rather durable and can be mounted using the given clamps, or if you want to install on a frame, bolt necks are available. Unit is very stable bolted into a frame. My only issue has been my Shifter (bought separately,) has button issues. Nothing on the wheel has degraded since.

author: Shubhendu Dey
title: Great steering wheel
content: Excellent product. Playing the racing games with this device is a great experience. The packing was also perfect.

author: Lijun W.
title: it tooks some time to set up
content: the drive is bad.  But you can go to youtube and search the setting if you want to.  at this price, i think it's good enough and fair. worth to buy.

author: John Showalter
title: G920 IS NOT FOR PC!!!
content: I can't believe Logitech STILL has not come up with proper PC drivers for this wheel!  They are quick to blame game companies for not supporting this wheel, but they wouldn't have to if Logitech would follow some sort of, I don't know, CONVENTION??? Come on, Logitech... how many years will it be before you discover game consoles and Windows personal computers are two different things?  I should have read the one star reviews more carefully, as this is a KNOWN ISSUE.  Pedal assignments are wrong and button assignments are backwards in NFS 2016.  For F1 2017, the wheel is only recognized part of the time.  I only bought this thing because the clamps on my Logitech G25 wheel finally gave out after 10 years or so.  This G920 is going back. I will do more research before buying another game console device "that also works on PC".  Oh, yeah... two other things.  Good luck cranking this wheel more than a half turn; the lower flat spot will make you loose grip.  The other thing, is the stupid, ultra bright, white LED by the X-Box button.  I covered it with three layers of blue painter's tape to be able to see it without blinding me.  Anyway, now I understand why USED G25 and G27 wheels sell for MUCH more than these new pieces of junk.  Logitech just lost my business... permanently.  And Amazon?  You guys should know better, and probably would if you actually read these reviews.

author: Kurt vaughn
title: Great service
content: Excellent

author: DocStrange
title: A complete waste of time
content:
Immediately crashed Windows 10 Desktop computer upon plugging in (BSOD).  System reboots, crashes again.  Ended up corrupting drivers and forcing a re-install of Windows 10.  A complete waste of time.  Even worse, the Logitech support forums have been reporting this problem for 10 days and there's still no acknowledgement from Logitech that the problem exists or is being addressed.  From what I've seen, there have been firmware and driver problems going on since launch.  Even if they fix this problem, I have no reason not to expect another disaster based on this product's track record so far.

The device itself is a high quality build.  Wish I could use it.

author: Scott
title: Bsod right out of the box.. But now fixed
content:
Bsod right out of the box! All windows 10 machines. Useless until they fix firmware driver issues. Support is slow. Affecting all Logitech wheels. Very expensive paper weight. Very disappointed in Logitech and Microsoft. They have released a set of updates that has rendered all Logitech wheels useless and bsod'ing all win10 systems. Very poor qa to say the least. All new and current wheels are broke! Consider a diff wheel mfg.

Update : after driver updates this is working great now.

author: skoal2008
title: Logitech G920 Racing Wheel
content: This is an excellent product,works really well,fun to use,makes racing games more realistic.

author: Dylan
title: Quality product and material. Worth the money.
content: Great product. My kid loves it.

author: Silnath
title: Kids love it
content: Great controller. Kids loved it for Christmas.

author: Anthony P.
title: The racing wheel works well, much more enjoyable
content: So far it’s been working very well. I have the racing wheel attached to a Playseat Challenge. The combination is fantastic. Racing games are much more enjoyable with the racing wheel than with the PS4 DS4 controller.

author: rich1295
title: Excellent Force Feedback Wheel
content: Excellent force feedback wheel. Made of very good material , good force feedback. Plenty of buttons like a controller to map out configurations. Easy setup

author: Connie Jones
title: Five Stars
content: Excellent product

author: Amazon Customer
title: Decent Video Game Driving/Racing Wheel
content:
I bought this for my PC.

Here are my highlights:

Pros:

The setup was a breeze even though it was designed for the PlayStation platform.

The hand-stitched leather wheel grip added some realistic feel when handling the wheel.

The force feedback added realism when playing a driving game, although the feel felt a little exaggerated.

Cons:

It's pricey.

It does not come bundled with a shifter.

The wheel feels small compared to real car wheels.

The brake pedal feels too stiff compared to a real car brake pedal.

author: George
title: Good, not great considering the price
content:
The only reason why I upgraded from the Driving Force GT to the g29 over the g27 is I also have a PS4. The wheel has pretty decent quality, but really isn't worth it in the end if you're looking for a wheel for the PC/PS3. If you're looking for a wheel for the PS4 you've got very few options.

The wheel:
Aside from the compatibility issues, the one major complaint I have with this wheel is that it's very toylike. It doesn't feel like a real steering wheel at all despite its "hand-stitched leather" and steel components. I don't understand why logitech won't increase the size of their steering wheels to a size even remotely close to the size of a real steering wheel. The lack of buttons from the g27 is noticeable, but at least it works out of the box with the PS4 and functions very well with it in my opinion. The paddle shifters feel amazing in my opinion, and are constructed out of stainless steel which not only has a nice finish but feels very durable and responsive.

The pedals:
The pedals feel great and are easily one of the better features of this wheel set. From the g27 they upgraded the brake pedal to simulate a load cell and it feels much better than previously, though still not quite as realistic as other options out there. I wish the floor mount of the pedals was constructed out of aluminum so it wouldn't look as cheap as it does, but it is a fairly durable plastic at least.

The H-shifter:
Now I know the H-shifter is not included, but it's basically part of the g29 package that you instead have to fork over an additional $60 to receive. If you're upgrading from the g27 for whatever reason, do NOT buy the separate h-shifter. It is completely identical minus the additional buttons from the g27. It still feels extremely toylike, and if you're buying this wheel strictly for the PC I wouldn't recommend buying the separate shifter. There are better, more realistic shifters out there well worth the additional cost. The thrustmaster th8a comes to mind, and is fully compatible with the wheel so long as you have an extra USB port available on your PC. If you're looking for a shifter that's compatible with both your PC and the PS4 with your g29 wheel then you're SOL.

Overall, I really don't think it's worth getting this wheel over the g27 unless you need a wheel for the PS4 as not only does it cost $100 more currently, it doesn't come with the H-shifter that the g27 includes, bringing the price difference to about $160 when you add the separate h-shifter's cost. The only real difference is the fact that it allows for PS4 compatibility (as artificial of a benefit as that is), and the brake more accurately simulates a load cell brake. The wheel is still extremely toylike but will get the job done if you're not looking for 100% immersion.

author: quickpatch
title: I can feel the car on the road and can drive much better in every game that supports the wheel
content: Driving force is a total game changer. I can feel the car on the road and can drive much better in every game that supports the wheel. I had a t-80 without force feedback. It was nice, but useless compared to this wheel.

author: Mike S.
title: great
content: Lots of fun

author: Cody Miller
title: Love it so far
content: Infinitely more solid than the G27 I had before. No manufacturing defects this time with the rotation sensor screwing up after a year, I hope. Love it so far. Mostly used for gentle driving with ETS2 and ATS, but still very good.

author: David Bump
title: Fantastic for Forza; trickier in Asseta Corsa and others lacking brake adjustment in game
content:
I've been using this for a month, and I love it.  It makes driving games incredibly immersive and fun.  Forza Motorsports 7 allows you to change the amount of brake throw that is needed for 100% braking, which is extremely useful with the G920's stiffer pedal.  The feel of the pedal is great, but it's extremely hard to depress the pedal fully, especially if the pedals and chair are not fastened together in some kind of cockpit rig.  Not all games allow you to change the "curve" of the brake pedal in that way.  Assetto Corsa--which is quite fun, and a little more of a sim feel--lacks that adjustment in the xbox version (the PC version has it), so I'm unable to reach more than about 90% braking force in the game, which has a huge impact for any competitive driving.  Project Cars II also allows you to change the brake range, but as far as I can tell, The Crew does not.  I believe Forza Horizons 3 & 4 share the same "deadzone" setting that Forza Motorsports has.  Unfortunately, without a wheel connected to your system, generally you cannot see the relevant settings to check if they exist in a game you enjoy.

One thing to note about this wheel--as long as it is connected to your xbox and to power, when you turn on the xbox (without even touching the wheel), the wheel will run through a calibration, where it rotates fully in both directions.  If you have a chair pushed in against the wheel when that happens, it can get a little exciting.  I've been careful to keep things clear of the wheel, but I can imagine the leather wrapping could get pretty scuffed up on accident this way.  Simply disconnect the USB cable (or unplug the power cord) to avoid this.

The clamping mechanism is really easy to use, and it's extremely effective--much better than the old Microsoft Wheel for the Xbox 360, which is the only other wheel I can compare it to.  Finger tight on the two knobs locks the wheel down completely--no amount of rapid turning against strong force feedback will twist it loose.

The buttons are all easy to press while driving, and roughly mirror the positions on a stock controller.  The LSB and RSB buttons reproduce pressing down on the analog sticks of the stock controller.  Not all games support these buttons on the wheel (Project Cars II definitely does--I have not found them to work in Forza however, which makes it hard to access some portions of the game, like Forzavista, context help in Tuning, etc.--fortunately, this doesn't impact any controls while driving, and you can launch the game with a normal controller to use those other functions).

author: Robert Palacios
title: Was fun till it broke, before even a month..
content: Racing wheel was a lot of fun, while it worked. Didn't even last a full month before the pedal box stopped working. Found that the wire was frayed coming out of the pedal box and is extremely chintzy. $250? uhhh why?

author: knocknet00
title: Five Stars
content: Wheel is too good.

author: Cristiano
title: The technical support was excellent but the wheel had to be destroyed and logitech ...
content: Unfortunately my G29 had a malfunction and I had to use the warranty. The technical support was excellent but the wheel had to be destroyed and logitech has no stock to replace for a new one. I am now waiting for a new stock availability.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Extremely Irritated
content: These items would be great to go with the simulator I purchased at the same time except they don’t provide any bolts to go with it. I would have given these items 5 stars if they would have provided the bolts to go with it instead of relying on the clamps for the steering wheel, the shifter and just setting the pedals down in the floor, carpet or simulator. Not everybody has carpet!! Some people buy the whole simulator and we would need bolts to secure these items to the simulator! Not very happy!! Don’t recommend products as compatible if you don’t provide everything necessary for set up!!

author: Joe Petrie
title: Superb!
content: Completely love it!

author: Dylan Coffey
title: Very hard to use.
content:
I was all kinds of excited to get this as an early Christmas gift, then that all turned into disappointment once I started to use it.
.
.
The wheel itself is very nice and made of high quality material. But the use of it was  ridiculously hard. Almost imposible. I wouldn’t suggest buying the gear shift either it dosen’t even work half the time.

author: riley
content: The wheel works good

author: LoriAnnR
title: Should consider buying or making a stand to use with this equipment
content:
The Logitect G29 Racing Wheel was the first racing wheel I have ever used.  Set up was simple but the racing wheel is not something that you’re going to want to be laying around your living room due to its large size.  There are multiple wires that connect the wheel to the pedals and to the PS3.  My son has a gaming room so it is perfect in there since we don't get fussy over orderliness in this room.

First problem we had was that the older PS3 games we already owned were not compatible with this model of racing wheel.  We purchased Gran Turismo 6 used and were finally able to test this product out.  The racing wheel is really cool and gives you a real life feel of driving a race car.  It drives very much like what you'd experience in an Arcade.  You'll want however to buy the stand to mount this equipment on or build a stand to place the wheel on to use it most effectively (which just adds to the already bloated price of this equipment).  The racing wheel does have built in table clamps.  I also like that it can be used for PS3 or PS4 in the event you plan to upgrade to the newer system.  Figuring out however which driving games will work with this driving system is a little confusing.

This feels very realistic and if you love gaming and you're not deterred by the large price tag, I believe that you'll feel that this is money well invested.

author: Tyler L. Morrison
title: I enjoy racing with this wheel!
content: mounted right up to my seat, If I had to think of a complaint I wish they had included longer cords for the USB and power.

author: Chesterwolf
title: Works well
content: Works well but i did't need it

author: Mfar
title: Buy only if you are using it for PS3/PS4 and NOT for PC
content:
I initially ordered a T150 for $200, but some of the guys I play GranTurismo 6 online recommended G29, so I ordered it. Nice wheel if you are going to use it for PS3 or PS4 and not PC.

If you are also planning to use it on PC, don't buy this wheel as it doesn't support many games. Only the most recent games are supported. Check Logitech website for supported game before you buy this. I called their tech support and although they were nice, i was told only a handful of most recent games are supported.

The wheel feels good, however the tachometer LED doesn't work on PS3, I think it only works on PS4.  The base for the pedals is so large that I couldn't fit it on my PlaySeat and had to modify the Playseat to accommodate it. the placement of the break and clutch pedals are so close to each other.

I am going back to my T150 that supports PS3/PS4 and all PC games.

author: Jim
title: Do not buy this for use on a PC.
content:
If you are going to use this product on a PC, do not buy this.  Installing this product on a PC is close to impossible.  The Logitech instructions provided and the instructions on their website absolutely do not work.
Eventually on youtube I found a video from an Argentinean buyer.  (I live in the US)  One needs to download the SW update 3 times, then configure and plug things in and from your PC in a specific sequence, then delete all the hidden icons, on and on.  It eventually worked.  What a nightmare.
I normally purchase Logitech products because they reliably work.  This is their 1st complete failure.  Do not buy this Logitech product for use on a PC

author: Geek Girl
title: Must have for racing enthusiasts
content:
Immediately out of the box you can tell this is a very high quality wheel. It's very sturdy and the leather finish paired with the stainless steel paddles and pedals are a very nice touch. Huge upgrade over our previous plastic wheel. We were previously using the Thrustmaster T80, which is much cheaper but also riddled with problems, so we were thrilled to try out the G29. I incorrectly assumed the stick shift was included with this as they are mentioned together frequently, but unfortunately that's a separate purchase. I can't comment on it for that reason, but I do plan to pick it up and will update my review when I've spent some time with it. That's where my complaints end on the G29.

We tried the G29 with DriveClub, Project Cars, Need for Speed Rivals, Rocket League, and Gran Turismo 6 on PS4 and countless more on PS3. It did not work for GTA V or The Crew. It's working well with our PC games, so far Euro Truck Simulator 2015, BeamNG.drive, and Spintires. Set up is extremely easy and the system recognizes the wheel right away. Controls are extremely responsive, and the feedback you get from driving is very realistic. You can feel the difference in terrain via the wheel and can instantly tell the difference between rough and smooth roads. Off-roading is great as well. You can use the wheel to control your entire system also, so you don't have to swap out your regular controller to navigate the menus and such when selecting your game, which is a nice bonus.

The pedals are also equally responsive, and feel weighted like a real car. The brakes are dampened as well so the harder you break, the more resistance you feel. One of the greatest features is the row of spikes that pop up from underneath the pedals to hook into your carpet and keep it from sliding around. This is a fantastic feature and really does it's job keeping the pedals in place. This makes it even more feasible to just use a table as a stand as you don't need a proper foot rest for the pedals to keep them from sliding. We have a racing stand, but it's a bit too big for my 10-year-old, so I'm thrilled with this option so he can play comfortably.

Last thing I want to mention is the noise. There is no noise from the wheel despite the powerful motor. The steel bearings allow it to run smoothly and silently. Overall this wheel is extremely well made and everything it promises to be. I didn't own the G27, but I understand it's made huge improvements over the last generation and it's certainly an upgrade over our previous wheel. For racing enthusiasts, it doesn't get any better than this. Logitech has been a favorite for PC accessories for years and they continue to keep up their line of high quality products for consoles as well. Highly recommended and worth every penny.

author: Jessica
title: works as advertised
content: works as advertised. very nice quality. impressed

author: Albey
title: Calibrating steering wheel is difficult also you need to install logitech gaming software
content: Calibrating steering wheel is difficult also you need to install logitech gaming software

author: Chris P Bacon
title: Works great! Before getting this
content:
Works great! Before getting this, it was completely impossible to drive the ovals on Forza without just getting wrecked. Very small inputs needed, which weren't really possible with the regular controller. It takes some getting used to using a wheel, but is fun once you get the hang of it!

ALSO: if you plug it in and it just blinks at you, you haven't plugged in the power source, only the data cable. I had this almost all the way boxed up ready to return until I looked at the power cable and thought "I'm not sure I plugged this in...". Derp. Blinking light doesn't mean plugged in, only half plugged in. It should rotate all the way to the left, then right, then center if it's working correctly.

author: Jack C
title: Wow, this is the Rolls Royce of steering wheels!
content:
I knew as soon as this arrived and the box was genuinely HEAVY that I was in for a treat.  I've been using a Logitech Driving Force GT wheel and although it's perfectly adequate and amazingly durable considering how much use it's seen, the G29 is a huge step up in every aspect.  First for setting it up - all the wires connect in a neat little compartment under the steering wheel enclosure.  The USB, power cable, cable from the pedals, and if you buy the optional shifter, that also attaches inside this compartment.  All wires exit neatly out the front which helps avoid the big mess of cables you can get with steering wheels.

When I turned it on the wheel rotated back and forth quietly and smoothly -  a big change from my DFGT which would noisily smack itself back and forth while centering.  This wheel works perfectly with Gran Turismo 6 on the PlayStation 3;  it's silky smooth and has wonderful force feedback.  It's also MUCH quieter than my DFGT.  The large paddle shifters work perfectly and have a nice click when engaged.  The pedals are metal and extremely solid, and the base has a flip-out "comb" type thing which holds it firmly in place on carpeting.  It also has rubberized feet it you're on a bare floor.

Overall the G29 is just a dream to play with.  Smooth as silk, high quality pedals and those wonderful paddle shifters.  My only nitpick is that the series of lights on the wheel which indicate your engine RPM don't work with GT6 on the PS3, but I imagine that's because this is a new product and they probably have to update the drivers or something.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The lack of proper support for this wheel is painful. I love my logitech gaming mouse
content: 2 words, DRIVER ISSUES.  The lack of proper support for this wheel is painful. I love my logitech gaming mouse, and the feel of the G29 seemed amazing...but it had too many issues. Seriously google G29 driver issues, and see just how many threads and possible outcomes you get. Just buy the G27 and save yourself a bunch of money.

author: AWarren
title: I love it! You can actually use them and not ...
content: Long time owner of g25 and g27. Purchased this as I wanted to get back into sim racing (iRacing) and I was skeptical about all the buttons on the steering wheel since I am used to most of them on the shifter. However, I love it! You can actually use them and not have to reach all the way over to the shifter which is convenient. The wheel feels the same as the g27, brake pedal is only real difference its much stiffer. Shifter is also a must purchase it feels good and solidly built. Love it!

author: Keith C.
title: everything works great. The problem is that the wheel keeps disconnecting
content:
I cannot compare the wheel to any other wheel, because this is the first wheel I've ever owned.  However, there is a slight problem with it.  I am running this wheel on Windows 10.  Had no problem downloading software and programming the buttons to work for American Truck Simulator.  When the wheel is connected, everything works great.  The problem is that the wheel keeps disconnecting, recalibrating and starting back up.  I have not been able to complete a trip without having to hit the pause button between 2 and 5 times and wait for the wheel to recalibrate so I can continue.  I have gone to Logitech to look for and try to get help with this problem, but so far there have been no answers.  If anyone here knows how to fix this problem, please let me know.  If a tech with Logitech contacts me with the fix, I will come back here and add it to this post to help out anyone else who may be having this problem.

The problem with some of these wheels are that there is a glitch or bug in either the wiring or maybe the circuit board, not sure which, which is causing the wheel to disconnect from the PC.  Not getting any help from Logitech, I finally exchanged the wheel for another one.  Plugged the new wheel into my PC and have been using it for a little more than a month now, with no problems.  Everything I need the wheel to do, it does it.  Since I will only be using this wheel for ATS and ETS2, I shouldn't have to do any hard turning from full left to full right, or the other direction, I feel that this wheel should last me a long time.  If anyone is having a problem with their wheel disconnecting from their PC and can't get it to stop, I suggest that you exchange it for another one.  I love the feel of this wheel and at this time, I have no issues with it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: It works great, the force feedback feels amazing
content: It works great, the force feedback feels amazing. The only thing is that the brake pedal gets pretty tough to press down.

author: jeff alexander
title: DON'T WASTE YOUR  $
content: I preordered ordered my g29 straight from Logitech and have been using it as much as possible with its limited compatibility and support. After several month I have came to the conclusion it was a rushed, redesigned driving force gt with a clutch and no where near the qualitity. Dfgt was $129.99 and g29 $400 with out the shifter. I also have a g27 that is miles better however does not work on ps4. I have used the g29 on ps4 and pc and very unsatisfied with my decision to purchase from logitech. Needless to say I won't purchase Logitech anymore. Driving force gt you could hear the force feedback loud and clear over bumps and curbs. Understandable for $130. I beat the piss out of the dfgt for 3 years, gave it to my nephew 2 yrs ago and he is still abusing it. Awsome wheel. G27 I've had for 2 yrs and can feel the force feedback but not hear it. It's quiet and came with the shifter for $299 full price. I purchased g27 off Amazon for $225. Now this g29 (pos) is not only louder than the dfgt but on older f1 game with KERS I can also hear clicks and cracks while driving. There is no way this wheel is gonna hold up like the older models do. Not to mention the fact Logitech came up with this as a last minute option therefore limiting time game developer have/had to program into the games. Some new game still don't support the wheel at all and the only game I have found that it works decently on is Project Cars. F1 2015  it somewhat functions. Wheel weight is non existing and force feedback is limited and everytime you load the game you have to go to setting and reset-up the wheel. This is on both pc and ps4. New Logitech profiler is absolute garbage compared to previous profilers. Half the settings you need for the steering wheel, that you used to have, don't exist now and the setting that are available don't transfer into the game like they should. I've not used the g29 near as much as I have the other and the wrapping is starting to come off the wheel. This has NEVER been an issue in the past. So, for $400 you get a lower quality driving force gt with a clutch. If you want a wheel buy the thrustmaster or fanatec. Here I was worried about thrustmasters quality as they have always been garbage but that what all my friends are on and they are completely satisfied.

author: Nate S.
title: Amazing mid level sim racing wheel.
content: Amazing mid level sim racing wheel. Way better than the cheap bungie steering wheels as the this wheel provides fantastic feedback.

author: EL
title: Solid wheel for a decent price
content: Excellent wheel for a solid price. Easy to set up, easy to configure. It feels solid in your hands, not super plastic-y. The buttons are responsive and the wheel centering feels nice. The brake pedal is a bit stiff, but otherwise the pedals feel quite nice to use.

author: JB
title: Solid if overpriced wheel, but let down by poor after-warranty support
content:
The Logitech G29 Driving Force Race Wheel is a solid product.  I say this as an owner of the previous Logitech G27 Racing Wheel for over five years.  From all indications the G29 is built to the same standards as the G27 and I would expect the lifespan and reliability to be similar.

Now that said, the two wheels are not *exactly* the same - the differences I am aware of are:
- The G29 costs about $80 more than the G27 when it first came out.  Value wise the G27 is better.
- The G29 does not come with a shifter like the G27 does, instead it is a separate purchase.  Another plus for the G27, though I will say this isn't a big issue for me as I use the paddle shifters on the wheel almost exclusively.
- The G29 is built to be compatible with the Sony PS4, while at this time the G27 cannot be used with the PS4.
- Though this can be used on both the PS4 and a PC, the button layout obviously lend itself to PS4 use.  (I am using it on a PC, mainly for iRacing.)
- The brake pedal has been modified to more closely resemble how an actual car brake feels - the pedal moves much less and encounters increasing resistance as the pedal is pushed down.  I like how the G29 succeeds in making the pedal feel a bit closer to a car's brake, but my son who races more than I do is not as impressed and prefers the G27 brake.  In all, this is a case of "different" but not necessarily "better".

So I would call this a 4-star product for PS4 users and a 3-star product for PC / PS3 users - except I have to dock the G29 for Logitech's poor after-warranty support.  Many parts on the G27 and G29 are made of plastic and can break, and other parts (the potentiometers or "pots" in the pedal system in particular) will wear out over time.  Logitech only had one spare part available for the G27 (the power adapter) has currently has no spare parts for the G29.  So if a part breaks or wears out and you are out of the warranty issue you will get no help whatsoever from Logitech.  In my case I asked about a lost screw that attaches the G27 shifter to a table and about worn out pedal pots - in each case Logitech said there was nothing they could do.  That might be tolerable for a cheap controller or mouse, but I do not consider a $400 racing wheel a throwaway product and I find this level of support unacceptable.

The fact that previous G27 owners are forced to upgrade to the G29 to race on the PS4 is also unfortunate (though I understand that this is at least partly Sony's fault).

So overall a solid if overpriced product.  I will enjoy this wheel as long as it remains trouble-free, but I know that after the warranty expires any support from Logitech is likely to be non-existent.  Also noted that the new generation of wheels (G29 and G920) has reduced the warranty from three years to two.

author: Cody
title: No Regrets Buying This Wheelset, It looks amazing and performs flawlessly!
content: I had a problem with my gas pedal, but Logitech support worked hard to ensure that the issue was resolved. A new unit has been arranged to be sent to my house, and I am highly satisfied with how efficiently things turned out on the support end, which compelled me to write this review. Moving on to the wheel itself, it is visually appealing and built with quality material. The wrapping on the wheel may be vinyl, I'm not sure exactly what material, but its holds up well with the look of the rest of the wheel. I was reluctant at first to buy it because I wanted a wheel with quality and wasn't sure where to start, but now that I have it I can say that the investment was solid. The software and framework is easy to work with. For the most part things are integrated pretty well and you could plug and play using options from the games you are playing. Most racing games register the device and it is easy to find when you want to switch from the keyboard or controller. I myself use the wheel and pedals and decided not to get the shifter, so I use my keyboard for shifting instead, which works very well. I can simultaneously use the wheel and my keyboard at the same time. On the performance end it is very responsive and works well for every driving or racing game. If I want to play Spintires or American Truck Simulator, the pedals and steering respond to my inputs well even if I am lightly touching the throttle or brake. The steering response is practically down to the millimeter and the force feedback immerses me into those games even more. I should note that I don't use force feedback in the high speed games as it's just a preference but in the few times I have tried it, I have felt every bump and every crest on the rally courses of DiRT Rally.  My racing and drifting experiences have been great with this wheel. I can honestly say that I have no complaints about this product, and I have no regrets buying it whatsoever. It mounts well by the way too

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: My son uses it all the time!

author: Tiraco
title: Five Stars
content: Better performance than I expected!

author: Andrew
title: Feel. ...everything
content:
I had a Thrustmaster T80 and knew this wheel would be a upgrade and it's a major upgrade!  Force feedback is great although takes a little getting used to and the clunking sounds from inside the wheel are the only thing that keeps you from feeling like you're really holding the wheel of a race car. Plenty of buttons to map out controls although some are not very easy to reach without taking a hand off the wheel so keep that in mind when mapping controls.
The pedals have some weight to them and on hardwood, will stay in place most of the time. There's even teeth on the bottom to help grab the carpet. I do have wide feet so the pedals are kind of hard to use because they are very close together.
Be careful of the wheel when it's first plugged in or turned on. It turns both directions lock to lock so be clear.
I already have a G430 headset from Logitech so they share the same gaming app on windows although I had to reset my headset for some reason. Making my speakers default then changing back to my headset fixed that.
In all, I enjoyed my first night with the G29 wheel. I have American Truck Simulator, Assetto Corsa, and iRacing

author: Amazon Customer
title: Four Stars
content: interesting

author: Amazon Customer
title: Use this with Forza on Xbox one and it's perfect. The brake is a little stiff to push ...
content: For sure 5 stars. Just plug it in and start racing. Use this with Forza on Xbox one and it's perfect. The brake is a little stiff to push down and can make the pedals scoot forward slightly. Other than that this has severely improved my experience with this game. The force feedback is better than anything else I've tried. Oversteer, hard braking, cornering and spinning tires. You feel it all. You can even feel the car slipping.  Well worth the money as it feels very sturdy. Not janky plastic.

author: Raymond C
title: Five Stars
content: The steering wheel feels better than my road car.

author: picnick
title: Very nice
content: It's a good item

author: Michael A. Claybourne
title: Ruined By Left Turns
content: I have a Logitech G25 and have had for years. It works well with my PC and my PS2, but now that I have an Xbox One I wanted to switch over to something I could actually use with it, enter the logical upgrade to the G920. It feels similar to the G25, though the build quality is not as good. The stitched leather on the wheel had some frayed stitches and the switches didn’t feel as nice. The power LED on the wheel itself is also very bright, a terrible idea for a device likely to be used in a dim room. In my initial tests I absolutely hated the brake pedal, which has extra resistance halfway through the travel. I did a lot of reading up on it, some seem to love it, others hate it. If you play simulation with ABS off it is tolerable, like I do in Forza 6. However, in a more arcade environment or with ABS on (Horizon 3) it is very, very annoying as it is almost impossible to get 100% braking pressure without feeling like you’re going to break the thing, or remapping the dead zones, which to me should not be needed in something retailing for $399. I actually switched in using my G25 pedals and was much happier. I hear there is a mod to change the pedals on the G920 to remove the piece of resistance, but it voids the otherwise generous warranty. Fortunately I didn’t, because shortly after the wheel started making a high pitches squealing sound everytime I turned left, power on or off. It’s loud enough you can’t drown it out and, in my opinion is unacceptable for a $399 product, especially as, after years of play, my G25 has no such issues. From what I’ve read mine is hardly an isolated issue, some going through multiple wheels before they got one that was at least tolerably quiet. As such, I returned the wheel and will wait for an unbeatable price or verified improvements in Logitech’s quality control. A shame as I have never had any issues with the company before, and I’ve bought a bit of their gear. Also irritating at how limited the range of Xbox wheels is as it can certainly enhance your game. Till then I’ll be back on the PC with the G25.

author: Zapix
title: HTC Vive + G920 wheel w/shifter + G933 headset + race seat = best VR racing experience!
content:
Decided to buy this to go along with my HTC Vive VR headset and DIRT Rally. Also bought a race seat from OpenWheeler to go with it.

Docking a star from the G920 because the brake pedal is ridiculous. Somebody at Logitech had the bright idea to stick a rubber block in the brake pedal shaft that basically makes pushing the brakes down impossible. Most games you'll need to use the same force as Crocodile's mouth to get 100% brake force unless you're willing to open up the G920 pedals and remove the stupid rubber block (and most likely, voiding your warranty in the process.) Some really should be fired for that decision.

Brake pedal aside, it's a great wheel! I haven't bought a new wheel since my old Logitech Driving Force Pro in the PS2 days with GranTurismo 3 and 4. It's kind of crazy spending an additional $750 (wheel + shifter + seat) for a single game I can play in VR, but it was totally worth it. I haven't REALLY enjoyed a racing game (with the exception of Wipeout) for a very long time, and the realism of the Vive + this wheel + the race seat makes it all worth it.

Bought this one instead of the G29 because I like the cleaner look of the G920, and more familiar with Xbox button placement instead of shapes which I can never remember the placement of.

As always, Logitech's high end stuff is good.

author: Scott Z
title: Five Stars
content: Works great.  Easy set up.

author: Juan Moreno
title: Disconnects from PS4
content: Randomly disconnects from PS4 wasnt even able to use it for more than 5 minutes to play Nascar Heat evolution without it disconnecting. And my usb ports work fine no issues with it.

author: Zach Salyer
title: Decent build quality, lasted a weeks before problems arose.
content: Terrible build quality, defects seem to be common with these wheels. Mine makes a VERY loud squeaking noise whenever its turned left, and I'm waiting to see if it qualifies for warranty, if it doesn't its going down to a 1 star rating. The mounting mechanism is a joke, my table has a small lip on the bottom so It is very unstable when mounted, my T150 didnt have this problem, the knobs to tighten them are difficult to grasp as they're a smooth plastic. They should have stuck with the screwed in rubber Y shaped system other pedals (even the high end wheels use this, and it works GREAT) The pedals are "ok" but you need a proper rig to be able to push the brake to 100 percent as its VERY stiff so having it on a carpet wouldn't work. Save up the money and get a thrustmaster, logitech cant make a reliable wheel and pedal set up.

author: Alisa Dawson

author: Devon Linderman
title: Very bad experience w/ Windows 10
content:
1.
Initial experience - plugged setup in and got an instant BSOD.
After deleting the default drivers in Windows 10 this went away and then the device did not work.

2.
After finally getting the drivers to work I get to use the brilliantly put together "Logitech Profiler" which takes several minutes to start on its own because each time it has to build some "game database" which is not network activity mine you - it's thrashing your disk - and this is on a modern i7 system with an SSD.

3.
After unplugging the wheel and turning the computer off for a day - it now does not work again (wheel turns on, calibrates itself, but is not detected by the all knowing Logitech Profiler and does not work in games.

The solution? Run the Logitech driver installation each time the computer is restarted.

Pathetic.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great wheel
content: Great wheel, lots of detail and handles in the games better than I would have thought.  Minimal hesitation (maybe milliseconds) from action to in game response.

author: Brian
title: Not happy with the quality for the price.
content: I'm not happy with the wheel honestly. for the price, I expected this wheel to be closer to top notch. It is not. The D-Pad is already starting to malfunction. It will jump all over the screen, on my Xbox, when I try to navigate with it. In game it does the same thing. I had the same problem with the Thrustmaster Ferrari 458 Spider Wheel that was half the price of the Logitech G920 Wheel. This is why I bought the Logitech. It seems to be an issue with most wheels. You would think that the designers would have worked that out by now. They have not. I was going to send the Logitech Wheel back but the trouble I went through with the Thrustmaster return was a nightmare. I'll take the loss and just deal with it. I doubt I'll buy from Logitech or Thrustmaster again honestly.

author: Todd Gilbert
title: A solid "B-" that could easily be made an "A-"
content:
I will not comment on the G27 to PS4 issue that prior owners are talking about - I never owned one so I have no comment.

I purchased the wheel to replace a Thrustmaster T80 RS PS4/PS3 Officially Licensed Racing Wheel which served me quite well for how cheap it was. I wanted the "road feel" I had none of with the cheap T80. After reading thread after thread about Thrustmaster VG T300RS Officially Licensed PS4/PS3 Force Feedback Racing Wheel or Thrustmaster T500RS Racing Wheel - Playstation 3 failing - I didn't want to risk that amount of money.  I just couldn't bring myself to do it - so I bought this wheel and the matching shifter (Logitech G Driving Force Shifter (941-000119)). I do think that their belt system likely feels better than the G29's gears.

Project CARS - PlayStation 4 is my main reference - I just don't care for Driveclub no matter how much I try. I only have ~2 hours of seat time with this wheel - but here are my initial thoughts (+ pro) (~ neutral) (- con):

+ The leather is stitched beautifully and smells great. The plastics are of high quality as are all the buttons. Its quality of materials is superb; better than the T80 by many fold (which for $ is expected).

+ The quality of pedals is astounding. They beat the feel of most real cars with excellent progression and placement. The base is heavy and extremely high quality. Color me impressed here.

+ The force feedback can be quite strong and does help "realism". It isn't all perfect as I'll get to in the cons below. In Project Cars make sure you have Steering Deadzone set to Zero. Otherwise recovering from a spin is impossible. The force feedback makes catching a slide very difficult and this setting exacerbates it greatly.

+ 900 degrees of turning radius is a huge benefit, much more than I thought before trying it. I now can do Monaco (Azure Circuit) which is actually impossible in the T80. Its beneficial on almost every track though - I didn't notice before how often I got to full-lock.

~ The force-feedback motors provide the steering weight. This feels a bit... grainy? Hard to come up with the right descriptor. Imagine if your real steering wheel was missing half of its ball bearings - feels about like that. For steering weight (and that alone) the T80 was actually better.

~ Using the add-on shifter in Project Cars with the Audi IMSA GTO is hilariously fun. I spent 20 minutes last night doing reverse J-turns having a blast.  The add-on shifter is fun - but does feel disconnected compared to the wheel. I think it would benefit from some stiffening bushings or even vibration when you notch it into gear. I didn't realize how much feel you get through the stick in a real car until I tried this.

- The paddle shifters need too much pressure. You get used to it but the T80 I used prior had a much more tactile click when switching gears. I've driven several cars with paddles (F430, M3, M5, etc..) and they all felt more crisp. A little sad that the $80 cheapo wheel beats this one in this regard.

- The quality of the wheel itself is a little flimsy. You can watch it flex when you use the paddle shifters which is disappointing. Would be nice if they used thicker metal or some structural bends to boost rigidity.

- The price! With the pedals this is nearly half a thousand dollars. That is approaching a month's payment on my 2012 BMW 750!

Overall its a solid "B-" that could easily be made an "A-" when on sale.

author: Robert B
title: Five Stars
content: Works great, installed on an openwheeler racing seat, works great! Currently used on our PS3 with no problems.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great way ti keep the kids busy

author: Amazon Customer

content: Best money I've ever spent on a controller. I couldn't be happeir with the quality of this product. The realism that this adds to any driving game makes any rave a thrill and the force feedback makes any turn or bump a challenge

author: cre8tive1

author: Edgar De Luna

content: Force feedback is great! Makes games feel completely different in a good way!

author: M. Holden
title: Doesn't work at all on PC
content:
Purchased this to replace a dead G27 which had gone for 8 years. Plugged in the 920 and it wouldn't power up, calibrate, or even show up in Windows. Tried many different possible fixes to no avail, it just sits there with the light flashing.

The good news is that my G27 suddenly works again, maybe you should get one of those instead.

author: Hector Fabelo
title: Couldn't be happier
content:
To anyone on the fence about buying a high quality racing wheel - look no further!

After two weeks of use, I am happy to report that the Logitech G29 is an excellent racing wheel. This was my very first wheel, purchased after conducting extensive research. When you grip it in your hands, you can feel the sheer quality of its materials - from its leather covering, to realistic feeling weighted pedals. Its settings are thoroughly adjustable, and it also highly compatible with all major racing games on both the PS4 and PC.

The force feedback is powerful and responsive. Truly adds a whole new level of immersion to my racing experience that I had never felt before. Some have complained about the wheel being loud during operation, but I disagree there. Occasionally you'll hear the FFB motors clacking, but it is by no means disruptive.

The paddle shifters are solid metal and produce a satisfying click. Overall, I'd recommend the Logitech G29 to anyone looking to get in the racing wheel game.

author: Mr. Bearomey Roberts
title: wheel
content: great Item

author: Paul D. Johnson Jr.
title: Waste of Money / Time.
content:
Wow, that was a fast waste of time and money. Returning in 24 hours. Everything worked perfect out of the box. Installed ProjectCars and ProjectCars2. Worked like a champ.

24 hours later, ProjectCars hung starting a race. G29 has not worked since.

Tried everything on the web. All drivers both windows 10 and game up to date. Can see this wheel in Devices; see the wheel in Hardware and Sounds > Devices and Printers. Under but Device Properties on the controller Advanced calibrate button is greyed out.

I've uninstalled Logitech drivers. Done, like this wheel, but it's a nightmare. Search the web, all kinds of connectivity issues.

Waste of Money / Time. I will post a rebuttal if this changes tonight as I'm sending back tomorrow. Life is too short.

author: Jim H
title: Difficult setup, but fun when it finally works
content:
I had a terrible time seeing this up on the Windows 7 machine I'm using. It didn't come with any documentation, only a graphical guide to wire hookup. Plugging it in, it would appear in the device manager but no drivers were ever found. On the Logitech site, no links to drivers were available. I finally found a 3rd party site with a link to the Logitech gaming software. Setting that up, unplugging the device, rebooting and plugging it back in finally resulted in the gaming software recognizing the wheel. A firmware update was performed, another reboot, and then it finally worked.
  Using it is great. I don't have any other devices for comparison, but this one definitely adds a level of realism to my F1 and Dirt games. Believe it or not, the main reason I purchased this is to get my kids some actual wheel time before they put the general public in jeopardy as drivers in a few years! They're learning and they don't even know it.
  I recommend the device for anyone looking for an affordable driving simulation solution. I also purchased the shifter, but have yet to configure and try it.

author: Ken Menard
title: OMG...How amazing!  Logitech G920 Is Awesome
content: When a friend told me to purchase this item, I was kind of hesitant...it is a lot of money for a steering wheel and pedals. Connecting it all up to my computer was a piece of cake. I plugged it in...and Windows 10 did the rest. (no configuring) I couldn't wait to see what Forza Horizon 3 would be like...so I launched it and away I went. At first, the force feedback of the wheel was too intense for me, so I lowered it down to 20% and now I can't get away from the computer. I LOVE to drive the cars...so much more realistic and I can control them so much better. If you have any doubts on which wheel and pedals to buy...get this one...and disregard the comments about the pedals being too hard. (they are fine just the way they are) I may buy the stick shift eventually, but taking your hands off the wheel to shift could make you crash...for right now, the paddle shifters on the steering wheel is the easiest way to stay in control. <3

author: BamBam
title: wheel worked great for first week or 2
content: wheel worked great for first week or 2. now it has a mind of its own and will randomly lose settings and turn every which way quickly then lock at 45 deg offset or lock hard over left or right. contatcted Logitech for warranty and have not heard back

author: wj565
title: it got worse, then the wheel would stay off center
content: Arrived on time, took it out of the box, connected to computer, would not calibrate or even work correctly. what I mean about that is, the brake you could not even depress, the buttons on the wheel seem to have a mind of there own, even after I deleted and re-downloaded the logitech software, it got worse, then the wheel would stay off center, and the foot pedals seamed to work in reverse. Sent email to Logitech, they had me do a bunch of things, then said send it back to us, it will take 7-10 days after you send it back to us to get you another?  I had this product 7 days, it has taken 4 days to get response from Logitech and still no return label from them.  Not very impressed with this product so far?  I can't give it 1 star as the product seemed to built well, and packaged well it just did not work well.

author: Justin Harris
title: Making trucking real good
content: Sooo good with American truck simulator

author: Amazon Customer
title: Avoid it with the PS4
content:
3 months ago the wheel started to show some symptoms of a problem, that now occurs pretty often, destroying all the gaming experience. While playing any racing game (I currently own Project Cars, Dirt Rally, WRC 5 and Asseto Corsa), the wheel disconnects and re-calibrates. This is such a huge problem, really annoying.

I heard from other users that the problem only happens with PS4, but I'm not able to verify that. I've enter in contact with support but got no response.

author: Mike Dame
title: This is a good wheel but there are a couple things you should ...
content:
This is a good wheel but there are a couple things you should know before buying:

- The brake is extremely stiff. This is clearly meant to be mounted to a racing seat because, sitting in a normal desk chair, I could not press the brake at all without rolling backwards. I don't think I could even stand on it. This was sort of easily fixed (you have to unscrew the pedals and remove a small rubber block in the spring) but still way more work than I wanted to be able to use all 3 pedals
- The paddle shifters are starting to work sporadically after about 6 months of use. I don't even actually use them that much (usually do H-shifter races) so I was kind of surprised when I tried them the other day and found only about 1 in 5 clicks to actually register

author: Alberto Arias Gutierrez
title: Expensive but excellent
content: Well done truly enjoy this with my son.

author: CommonSense
title: Failed after less than 100 hours of use -- poor customer support.
content:
Worked fine for less than 100 hours of use. I bought this for GT Sport last summer (2016) before they pushed back their release to Fall 2017. One day the wheel centering spring/mechanism failed and the wheel became incredibly stiff and always forced its self to return to center, regardless of what game I tried to play or if I plugged it into my PC or PS4. After firmware updates and power cycling for a month this was never fixed. This is a known issue with this unit as I found out in a logitech reddit thread.

Their customer support sucks. Don't even bother emailing them with a warranty claim as they seem to only have a part time worker answering those emails and apparently they are flooded with claims. I'm kicking myself for not getting a thrustmaster now. What a waste of money ....

author: truss
title: PLEASE DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT
content: Please don't buy, after one month it stopped working no steering capability no gear changing functionality, it just stopped. I am severely stressed because all my friends have thrust masters and I bought this, trusting in the company's ability to produce a flawless product and this $399 plus shipping down the drain, just a day after the 28th day return date it's disappointing, my first wheel. PLEASE DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT. I gave one star because I couldn't submit my review unless I gave a star, in my opinion zero(0) stars. Also they sent me a refer bushed replacement after contact, and look not even a year later it's malfunctioning, DON'T BUY PLEASE.

author: Kayihan Kiryaman
content:
This is my first racing wheel for a PC or gaming platform and I now realize why they exist. I should've gotten one sooner.

This new setup is fantastic. I have had it for 2 days now and decided to write this review. I have used it on Xbox one with Forza 5 and I give it a 4/5 on there. Why not 5/5? I don't think it was developed using console games and was dedicated to be a PC wheel with the option of console. I say this because I used the wheel on my PC today with PROJECT CARS and I am mind blown. Night and day difference between the console and PC in terms of performance therefore it gets a 5/5 when used with a PC.

Why? The steering feedback felt much more refined especially the turning (Forza maxes out where in Project Cars the wheel can be turned to full max and the simulator does the same). More accuracy to say the least. I'll try to compare with Forza 6 and report back if I have time.

Regarding the fit and finish (I also have the shifter assembly which is outstanding) it gets an A+. The feel of the wheel and shifter and pedals are very nice. Install way a breeze. (For PC you have to download the driver from Logitech website, Xbox is plug & play). The one thing that caught my attention is the hardness of the brake pedal. It is a bit tough but gives more feel to the experience of a real pedal but it is def. on the stiff side which I saw in other reviews as well. If you play without shoes for a extended period of time the bottom of your foot WILL hurt (ask me how I know) so in order for not to happen, shoes are recommended. Especially when not left foot braking.

In conclusion, I am very happy with my purchase. I have it mated to the Openwheeler Racing Wheel Stand Cockpit which is also superb given the price.

author: John
title: Five Stars
content: I'm having a lot of fun with it!!

author: PlatyPusheen
title: Awesome wheel
content: Great solid wheel. Needs solid table or the whole set up for it though. I have played need for speed and dirt rally on it.

author: Peter
title: Feels good.
content: Feels good and its easy to setup but the break pedal seems broken, mine wont go past like 70% and that's a no go for me. I heard you can alter the break but that voids the warranty.

author: Dale R.
title: Simply Awesome!
content:
I've been thoroughly impressed with my racing wheel. It's absolutely incredible the difference this peripheral makes. Trying to play any racing/driving games with a controller had been my primary way of gaming, but this racing wheel made steering so much better. When I first started looking at getting a racing wheel, I went for a $100 mid-range one that I felt fit my budget better. However, I quickly learned that all racing wheels are definitely NOT created equal. Although this racing wheel is very expensive, it's been worth it to me. I'm impressed with the build quality, and it was a surprise to see that the wheel is wrapped in real leather too.

I really like the pedals as well. The base is heavy enough that it doesn't move when I'm moving my feet frantically accelerating & braking. On that note too, I don't quite understand the fault with the brake pedal? Other reviews that I've read on here have faulted it, but it feels pretty nice to me, and I'm able to brake pretty well with the games I'm playing.

Overall the quality of the device is excellent, performance has been great, and setup was easy. This racing wheel has made the racing experience so much better; It's the difference between night and day. If you're looking for a racing wheel, I highly recommend the G29. I love it.

author: Mike Q
title: Great Fun!
content:
Great wheel force feedback great paddle shifters work well also got the H shifter and it is
nice use on forza 6 and Aesseto corsa

author: Christophe M. Gonzalez-Dias
title: For the price  ($205) it's hard to beat.
content:
Originally I had been set on buying the Thrustmaster t300 rs gt and while that also would have been a great wheel set (and more upgrade-able), it was nearly $100 more than the logitech. And for someone like myself who simply just wants to see what a force feedback wheel system can do for my in game excitement I didn't want to break the bank.

So in comes the G29 set.

It met most of my expectations except for the brake pedal. While I appreciate and I do like the non linear action, I feel that they could work on lessening the overall force required to press the brake pedal. With that, it makes it a little unwieldy if you have to use the setup without a proper wheel stand or cockpit.

You do also need to make sure to adjust your settings in the G Hub application because you may find that in certain games having 900 degrees of rotation is quite a bit too much, namely driving an F1 simulator.

As for the force feedback provided, I have to say it is a thrilling addition to a racing wheel and I do feel my money was well spent. The force of the feedback can be turned up to the point where I could hardly even turn the wheel on high speed corners. And I was able to reduce the feedback down to a point where I felt comfortable doing high speed and low speed corners without having to fight the wheel too much.

All in all, it did require a lot more setup than I had expected but when you realize how many adjustments can be made within the program as well as the game you're playing, you understand why it is necessary to make adjustments to suit your own abilities rather than have a one size fits all option.

If I was buying again though, knowing what I know now, I would probably spend the extra money on the Thrustmaster setup giving me the ability to upgrade to a proper F1 racing wheel replica. But that will be a future purchase I'm sure as I get more accustomed to racing sims with actual wheel and pedals.

author: Jeff SooHoo
title: This is a $100 wheel at best.
content: You can feel the gears too much making turns feel really "grindy" and not smooth at all if you have the force feedback on at all.  Wheel is wrapped with a high quality leather/fake leather wrap.  Pedals are too close together regardless of what position you screw them to the base.  Any time you hit a bump or rumble strip, the clank from the base of the wheel is extremely loud and off putting.  This is a $100 wheel at best.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Perfect!!
content: Very good gaming gear!!

author: Andy Lugo
title: Super 👍
content: Buen volante ya varios meses sin problemas 👍

author: Vijay Bansal
title: Fun wheel!
content: Nice!

author: NYNY
title: expensive useless wheel
content: Wow! What a crappy wheel! I spend almost 5 hours trying to configure it to play with Forza 7 and Horizon 3 on my Xbox X. I even tried other suggestions from youtube. Nothing works. This wheel got a mind of its own. I even set it to beginner but it just want to crash the car. The feedback and return to center is always too strong so you're basically fighting the wheel instead of driving the car.

author: Rustin Crawford
title: Great built quality and fun.
content: The built quality is really great. Solid, high quality materials. Only limitation is the mounts are tricky to use. Not an issue unless you need to move it regularly.

author: KS
title: Try to avoid
content:
Disclaimer: This is my first wheel

The Bad:
1) Mine has a screeching noise when I turn the wheel to the left, both when powered on and off, this is a high pitch and loud noise that is easily hearable even when speakers are at high levels - extremely annoying, I sent mine for a replacement, but Logitech's main and only distributor in Turkey just sent it back, after 3 weeks, doing absolutely nothing, probably the package was even unopened (the package was also damaged from their mis-handling), by infringing my rights as a customer, as there is a 14 days return period
2) The break pedal is just awful, you definitely need to open it up and remove the rubber, I bought a Playseat Challenge, the stiffness of the break could break the chair's connections
3) Once for unknown reasons the PC lost connection, I don't know whether it's a chronic issue

The Good
1) I only considered a Thrustmaster as people report the middle is a dead zone, but practically it's not true, on Dirt Rally the FFB worked as expected in the mid region too - tho the FFB is overall weak and boring, but don't take this as a comparison, as this is my first FFB wheel

Verdict: It's annoying, it's trouble, not only I wasted $700+ with everything involved but the Logitech here really messed with my nerves, if anyone from Logitech reads this, please consider dropping your relationship with "Penta" - they are making people hate Logitech products, as I read from online complaints, it's a widespread issue

author: Joe A.
title: Awesome for Dirt Rally. Has issues with GT Sport
content:
This unit is 100% excellent for Dirt Rally with the shifter.

On GT Sport, the shifter/clutch doesn't really work right. The game doesn't even require the clutch to shift, you can just throw it to the next gear which I really don't like.

Lucky for me, the Dirt Rally series is my favorite sim, so I will stick to that.

author: Franklin N.
title: The wheel is amazing! I've always used logitec and came from a ...
content:
The wheel is amazing! I've always used logitec and came from a logitec gt which is the entry model. I have tried other wheels like fanatec and wasn't thrilling at all, I gave Fanatec a chance to make things right and they said no, this is the only reason I'm talking negative on this review, I lost a lot of money and time with their drive by belt wheel, that has no feeling and it's complicated to use. The G29 was plug and play, this is why I highly recommend this wheel.
My previous GT wheel lasted me over 4 years and still working, only reason for upgrade it won't work with the PS4.
I hope the quality of this wheel will yield another 4 + great more years.

author: Corey
title: Worked good for 5-6 days then the buttons started doing what ...
content: Worked good for 5-6 days then the buttons started doing what they wanted to. I hooked this up to 2 PC's and a ps4 just to be sure it wasn't my equipment. I would be in a middle of a race and all of a sudden it would pause or change camera angles. I am certain that L3, R3, X, O, and Square were faulty. The wheel felt ok while racing, maybe a little less grit and smoothness over the G27. Spend the extra money and get a t300rs it is night and day as far as smoothness and real feel. I would give this a 4 if the buttons did not have a mind of their own.

author: Amazon Customer

author: woods bishop
title: Great addition to Gran Tourismo, or any racing game
content: Takes a few setting changes, and some time to get use to. Once you do, it's pure pleasure. Something I did not realize when buying, you're going to need to bolt the wheel down to a table, desk, or racing / gaming chair. The pedals are great, and even though the bottom has teeth to grab carpet, it still moves around. Locking / applying pressure against something is required, if you're not bolting the pedals to a unit. Wheel, and paddle shifters are good quality. Overall, very happy.

author: Andrew Dittel

author: Erick F
title: Great setup for drifting
content: Love how responsive this is. It's a bit hard at first but it takes lots of getting used too. Just go for it and stick with it for a bit. I use to drift on forza

author: Martin J Miller
title: These are NOT durable at all!  Great wheel... Until it stops working with little to no use.
content:
Lets start by saying this wheel was great! It was simple to install, worked for the most part in my rig, and did its job. When I actually used it...  Then with less than 100hrs total use, it decides to not power on.  Contact logitech support? No response for 3 days.  Contact the instant chat support livid that I have recieved zero response,  my wheel is now out of warranty with little to no use on it.  Logitech tries to hand me a 15% discount code like that will help with anything on their now defective product. Tested power leads and other items and they are all good.  Support is USELESS, they asked, and asked again the same questions, had me redo the troubleshooting three TIMES!  At which point they then asked about the serial and contact info (which I have already provided twice) Then come back to tell me, sorry you're out of warranty we can't help you.  Pathetic!  DO NOT BUY THIS WITHOUT ADDITIONAL WARRANTY BEYOND 2 YEARS! Square trade and other such warranties are your friend here. Don't buy it from amazon, buy it from walmart or direct from best buy in order to get the additional warranty.

As for the quality of the device, well its decent but not the best.  It does feel cheap and sort of flexible. I would definitely look at getting a thrustmaster level quality or higher unless you're just looking for a cheap wheel to play with until it breaks and replace it.

author: Peyton H.
title: Amazing Steering Wheel
content: The G920 is an amazing steering wheel. I am very happy with it and I got it in 2 days! Very happy with the steering wheel and I also got the shifter and I am very satisfied. I would definitely recommend!

author: ka tet
title: Wait for a sale
content: It's worked surprisingly well. I didn't want to spend a silly amount of money on a Fanatec setup. This is working just great for me. I don't think I needed the shifter. I use the paddle shifters more than anything. I'm keeping the H pattern shifter for drifting I guess.

author: Jason P
title: Great Wheel, but change the brake deadzone.
content:
The wheel is as expected. If your using it on xbox (PS4), then it's a plug and go setup. If you plug it into your PC, then you need to download Logitech's G software that's hidden on their website. This is my first wheel, so I was lost trying to dial in the right settings for my wheel. I used YouTube and Reddit to get an idea of what I wanted for each game (Forza 7 and F1 2019).

The pedals are a whole other beast. The throttle and clutch are nice, but the brakes are wild. There's a rubber stopper in the brake to make it extra stiff towards the end (non linear brakes). The problem is that the rubber stopper is to firm with little give. The amount of pressure needed to fully actuate the wheel results in my hole playseat challenge to shift. You can remedy the situation by voiding the warranty and removing the stopper, or replacing it with something with less resistance. Lucky there's a modding community for the Logitech G series of wheels and pedals. Another option is to adjust the brake dead zones in game. If you decide to adjust the brake deadzones you won't void your warranty, and will still benefit from progressive braking.

Overall I am pleased with my wheel and pedals. You definitely need to adjust the settings to your driving style and should consider get a wheel stand or Playseat Challenge. Altogether, my setup has brought my driving to a new level.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I watch the thing move

author: Javitz
